*This ability scales with [#](449900)Efficiency[#]() and [#](449900)Power[#](), improving yield and damage.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.glass_panes.text: I can also make matching Glass Panes from them.
book.spectrum.guidebook.gleaming_pin.pag:
On one of my recent expeditions I was hit by arrows time and time again, only to look around in panic and miss my enemy completely - it had already disappeared around the next corner.\
\
When I get hit, the Gleaming Pin emits a magical surge that even penetrates walls and attaches itself to nearby creatures, making them easy to track.
Sniping allows the surge to pierce even more matter, increasing its range.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glistering_jelly:
I came to know [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines) for their regenerative properties, similar to [#](bb00bb)Glistering Melons[#](). Coincidentally, mixing them together produces an exquisitely harmonious, sweet taste.\
\
Temporarily grants a small health boost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glistering_melon:
I [managed to transform seedlings](entry://general/colored_trees), so what's stopping me from trying it on other plants?\
Not because I'm a bit greedy or anything, of course. Pure interest.
book.spectrum.guidebook.gloves_of_dawns_:
When I asked my neighbor what this "[#](bb00bb)Gobber[#]()" was that they were always talking about, the only answer I got was that this godlike material was "out of reach for you, little artist".\
Before they could explain to me that "out of reach" was not to be taken literally, I had already designed these gloves. Oops.

Oh, well, now that I've thought them up, *I'm going to use them*!\
\
Infusing it with [Light Blue Ink](entry://ink/ink) increases the extra reach it provides.
book.spectrum.guidebook.glow_vision_gogg:
If there was a vote for my favourite mob I would choose the Glow Squid *every time*! I love how they light my way in the darkness of the caves. Beautiful as they are, they seem to wash ashore far too often and meet a sad end.\
I have honored their clumsy glowing legacy by designing glasses that will continue to guide me.
If I am in a dark area and have Glow Ink Sacs on me, Glow Vision Goggles grant me [#](449900)Night Vision[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.glowblocks.name: Glowblocks
book.spectrum.guidebook.glowblocks.page0:
I now have pigments as pure as can be. So why not make blocks with color as pure as can be!\
\
I thought about calling them [#](449900)Antiblocks[#](), but since they are indeed blocks that would be silly, wouldn't it?
book.spectrum.guidebook.glowblocks.page1: Glowblocks glow from the inside so they always look the same, no matter how much light falls on their surface.
book.spectrum.guidebook.greater_potion_p:
Works very much like its [little brother](entry://brewing/lesser_potion_pendant).\
However, this version has three chambers, each of which can be filled with a different potion - meaning it can only support level I effects.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hardcore_revival:
I have made a discovery. The universe seems to be much kinder to me than anything else around me. Whenever I have blacked out from too much damage, I have always woken up healthy and fit again, as if I had been given new life.\
Though what if I can't always cheat death? I've come up with a failsafe in case things ever go horribly wrong.
To revive a player that died in [#](449900)Hardcore[#](), I will need [#](bb00bb)their personal Player Head[#](), a hefty sum of resources and a bit of time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.heartbound_chest:
I often find myself placing down a box to store my belongings, only to return to find everything looted.\
\
This special chest can even help me protect my stuff as well as catch the thief red-handed.
Can only be opened by the person who placed it, and has the same space as two mundane chests.

Similar to a Trapped Chest it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
If I, as the owner, open it, the signal strength will be full; if a stranger tries to tamper with my belongings then only half.
book.spectrum.guidebook.heartsingers_rew: This dainty ring has it all: with the help of a little (or a lot!) of [#](d6658f)Pink Ink[#](), it strengthens me from within, granting me extra hearts.
Infused with [Pink Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) increases the amount of extra hearts provided.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.amethyst.p: There is a type of geode found deep underground.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.azurite.pa: There is a new deep blue ore that can be found in all biomes on the Overworld.
This rich blue ore generates at the lowest depths of the world. It is buried within rock in rare, but giant clusters. Its location is revealed by a striking blue aura.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.citrine.pa: There is one type of geode that is commonly found near the surface. It is most likely to be found exposed in lakes or ravines.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.clover.pag: Search for a Plains biome. You might get lucky!

Clovers grow in small patches in Plains biomes, most of them with three leaves, but some with four. You can tell a Four-Leaved Clover from a three-leaved one in its block shape already. They can be spread using Bone meal or the Nature's Staff.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.downstone_: The deeper you dig into the underground of the Deeper Down, the more often you will come across rocks that seem indestructible. At this level, there is a structure to be discovered.

Near the lowest levels of the Deeper Down, you will sometimes come across structures used by the former inhabitants to carve this stone. Inside one of the chests in this structure you will find a new resource.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.dragonbone: In Dragonrot Swamps, you can find the remains of giant creatures. These blocks seem to be impossible to mine in the traditional way, since they are protected by a magical aura. Is there an unconventional way to break this aura, perhaps using great force?

The magical aura of Dragonbone Blocks can be breached using powerful explosions. You will need something with a bit more explosive power than TNT, such as Incandescent Amalgam. Powerful magical explosions have the same effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.fading.pag: Fading is a small and weak organism that feeds on organic blocks placed next to it. Right-click the bottle to place it as a block; you can bottle them again by using an empty bottle.

Place organic blocks such as Leaves, Pumpkins or Melons next to a Block of Fading and wait a while. The block will be consumed and replaced by a different looking one. Break this converted block to get a new resource.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.failing.pa: Just like Fading, they prefer a specific block placed next to them. Much stronger this time, though. 'I hate mining this'-strong, to be precise.
Their favorite food is Obsidian. But beware of their insatiable hunger. They will eat a lot if given the chance...
There is a new ore that can be found in the Deeper Down.
It is bright green and can be found in the deepest parts of Deeper Down. It's not often found exposed to the air, so the best way to get it is by branch mining.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.mermaids_g: Sometimes shiny gems can be found in oceans, floating on the surface and tossed around by the waves. If you spend some time near or in an ocean, you might find one yourself!

The source of these gems is a coral-like plant that grows in small groups on the seabed, disguised as sea grass. Wait besides it or bone meal it and it will release its precious treasure. After you collect one, you will be able to see the plant for what it is.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.midnight_c: This liquid, created during the creation of the Midnight Aberration... it damages every creature it touches.

Midnight Solution has different effects depending on what lands in it. Enchanted items lose their magical powers, some items change completely, and creatures killed by it drop a small, mysterious fragment.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.moonstone_: The lower plains of the Deeper Down appear to have once been home to a highly advanced civilisation.
Some of the cities left behind house a heavily guarded structure. Their protectors appear to be mechanical and very unfriendly, powered by delicate magitech.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.name: Progression Hints
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.nightdew_s: There is something fragrant in the soil, but you can't quite nail down its location. Surely, a keener sense of smell would help here.
The dormant sprigs of an unusual vine are scattered in the soil beneath your feet. While they are too delicate and elusive for you to dig up, a Sniffer would be naturally suited to the task.
A turquoise ore can  be found in the End.
This ore can be found both on the central island and in the outer regions of the End. It generates exposed to air just rarely. It has a common and a rare drop. Catch it before it's too late!
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.preservati:
There are three different types of impenetrable structures hidden near the beginning of the Deepslate layer in the Overworld in every biome.\
They appear to be made of an unbreakable stone.

The entrance seems to be blocked by a powerful force field. However, whoever built it was kind enough to leave you some clues! The hearts on the sides of the force field indicate that you need to have Azure Dike active.
The Colored Spore Blossoms on the ceiling and the engravings on the walls behind them hint at the solution. A powder engraving and a '? + ?'. You have to mix Gemstone Powder.

Is there a way to crack the Bedrock? Once you are inside, it is best to look at the relevant pages in your book for the blocks you find there. Another tip: It is always good to have some dyes with you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.quitoxic_r: Time for an adventure trip on the surface. Visit a Swamp or Mangrove Swamp!
Strange-looking plants have been seen in all sorts of swamps, growing on patches of Clay or Mud. In order to grow, they consume Clay/Mud placed around them, turning it into Dirt.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.radiating_: Not every block carried by an Enderman is what it seems at first glance.

Some Endermen will appear carrying blocks that could very well be small relics of the End itself. You can get one by killing an Enderman while it is carrying something that looks like Cobblestone. Endermen holding these blocks can also be found in the End, albeit more rarely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonance_: Between lakes of Liquid Crystal, you can often find crystalline structures made up of blocks that take on interesting properties when interacted with.

Hummingstones, part of crystal formations in the Crystal Gardens biome, begin to vibrate when disturbed, causing other nearby Hummingstones in their vicinity vibrate as well. The more stones there are, the stronger the echo will be.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.resonant_l: In [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens), flowers that grow near [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) have strange characteristics. Has their proximity to the liquid changed them?.
I don't have that much time to grow a whole new plant like that. But what if I simply throw an existing plant into the liquid to speed up the process?
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.name: Experiment #3
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page0: This absolutely aggressive version called Ruin is capable of consuming the most resistant material there is. Even one too resistant for you to ever break before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.ruin.page1: What could be more resilient than the unbreakable Bedrock floor itself? Better have some Decay Away up your sleeve a backup plan in case things get out of hand.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.shimmersto: There is an ore in the Overworld at and above surface level.
It generates in large deposits in all biomes in the middle and upper layers of the Overworld. It is most commonly found exposed in mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stargazing: Shooting Stars only appear at night. Having something to help you see them in the dark will certainly help. They produce a noticeable particle trail.

Your best chance of seeing a Shooting Star is to look for it with Night Vision and a Spyglass. If you see one crashing down, try following its path to find out where it landed. They shoot particles up in a beam-like shape.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.storm_ston: Thunderstorms are a powerful display of nature. Enormous energies are at play.
Sometimes you can find strange shards at places where lightning has struck. There is even a vanilla way to focus lightning on a specific location, to make collecting it even more efficient.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.stratine.p: There is a red ore in the Nether.
It can be found in the lower layers of the Nether in all biomes below lava level. It has a common and a rare drop.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hints.topaz.page: This type of geode is found at great heights, typically on top of hills and sky-high mountains.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hoverblock.page0: Created from a collision of [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) and [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), this block just... floats around, vibing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hoverblock.page1:
...well, most other placed blocks seem to be able to float in the air without support just fine for whatever reason, too, but this one is special: [#](449900)it retains any momentum I give it[#](), like when using a [#](bb00bb)Piston[#](), even if I stand on it.\
\
Sneak+Use to pick it up again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.howling_spires.a:
While it seemed like snow at first, I can see now that this place is blanketed in white ash. The wind roars, bringing with it a rain of ash not unlike a gentle, everlasting snowfall.\
\
I wonder where it comes from.
book.spectrum.guidebook.howling_spires.p: Silvered fog hides the land in a veil of white; these wind hewn caves are icy, but there is no snow in this place.
book.spectrum.guidebook.howling_spires.v: Luminous ground cover plants that are not unlike thick tufts of grass. Graceful, yet they seem otherworldly to me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.hummingstone.pag: Amongst the crystalline blocks I found these different ones that emit a pleasant hum when triggered. I feel that *Hummingstone* makes for a fitting name.
This very strong, blast-resistant crystal is scattered throughout the [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens).
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.name: Idols
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page0.text:
Manifestations of a creature in block form.\
\
Using them, walking on them, or hitting them with a projectile triggers an action specifically associated with that creature.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page1.text: Gives a short burst of Regeneration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page10.tex: Teleports to a random position up to 16 block away.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page11.tex: Teleports to another Jagged Idol in a straight line up to 16 blocks away.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page13.tex: Gives a short burst of Water Breathing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page14.tex: Gives a short burst of Haste.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page16.tex: Gives a short burst of Glowing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page18.tex: Gives a short burst Mining Fatigue.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page19.tex: Gives a short burst of Strength.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page2.text: Echolocates creatures within an 8 blocks radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page20.tex: Gives a short burst of Invisibility.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page21.tex: Gives a short burst of Night Vision.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page22.tex: Gives a short burst of Absorption.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page23.tex:
Causes Insomnia.\
When in open sky, a player will immediately get haunted by a [#](449900)Phantom[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page24.tex: Feeds animals in a 6 block radius using food lying around.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page26.tex: Freezes blocks around it (freezing [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Ice[#](), cooling [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), ...).
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page27.tex: Gives a short burst of Nausea.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page28.tex: Gives a short burst of Jump Boost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page29.tex: Shears creatures in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page30.tex: Gives a short burst of Levitation.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page31.tex: Invades blocks next to it with Silverfish.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page33.tex: Increases the size of Slimes in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page35.tex: Gives a short burst of Poison.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page36.tex: Gives a short burst of Blindness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page37.tex: Gives a short burst of Slowness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page38.tex: Gives a short burst of Fire Resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page39.tex: Gives a short burst of Resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page4.text:
Smelts ore, and other blocks, such as [#](bb00bb)Netherrack[#]() to [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#](), ...)\
Also sets fire to the creature that triggered it and any nearby blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page40.tex: Gives a short burst of Weakness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page42.tex: Gives a short burst of Wither.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page5.text: Negates all fall damage when landed upon. Also resets fall damage when hit.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page6.text: Gives a short burst of Slow Falling.
book.spectrum.guidebook.idols.page7.text: Milks all Cows, Goats and Mooshrooms in a 6 block radius.
book.spectrum.guidebook.imbrifer_cookboo:
Welcome. Lets not get caught up with introductions - you're here because you want to learn how to cook, I can teach you. I studied in the Meriloux Culinary College, the finest culinary institution in the deep; I trained under the mentorship of Imperial Chef Aeverstrone, catering for the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon bloodline[#](); I, with a team of my own apprentices, brought Imbrifer its first full-lotus restaurant. \
\
*Follow my lead and I'll teach you true taste.*

\
I am not a brewer, and thus I cannot give much past the ingredients for Aqua Regia.\
\
But I can note that, for the good chef, it is essential to understand your ingredients and how they are made. You cannot judge quality if you do not know how quality is created.
*Know your ingredients, learn them, understand them.*

\
Everybody has to start somewhere, and for my students, this is that somewhere. Crawfish Cocktails are deceiving, they seem simple, but to truly master them takes finesse and practice. It is possible to flambÃ© the peaches and spices to make a sweet, syrupy, spicy sauce without cooking the crawfish, but it demands an immense amount of care. I use this to filter new students.

*It can take hundreds of tries to get it right the first time.\
\
Many will crack before that.*

\
Bagnun is a culinary school classic. A heavily spiced, luxurious soup cut by a dollop of fresh cream; the contrast of scarlet, peppery soup and refreshing pearly cream makes a feast for the eyes and tongue alike. There was a woman I used to know of melochites. She loved a soup not too dissimilar to this one. We used to be good friends long ago, she called me egocentric.

\
The various plants of the Jade genus are generally desirable.\
\
Their bulbs in particular are highly sought after, being alike onions in texture, but more delicate, sweet and ethereal in taste, earning them the moniker of truffles of the deep. This recipe makes use of a modern crossbreed of two native species - the striking [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines).

*I've heard Jade Vine nectar has restorative properties...\
\
what a curious crossbreed.*

\
If anyone tells you that you need to cook fishcake, they're not just wrong, but also stupid. The proper way to prepare fishcake is to first spice and paste your fish, then let it ferment in a bath of nephrite vinegar for at least 72 hours. This will not just kill any parasites in the fish, but also cure the cake, giving it its signature pink color.
*The finest fishcake cures for months, if not years.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.immunity.page0.t: [#](449900)Removed all negative status effects[#]() and prevented me from getting any new ones, as long as Immunity was active
book.spectrum.guidebook.immunity.page1.t: Some singular effects seem to be powerful enough to bypass this immunity, though.
book.spectrum.guidebook.imperial_cookboo:
*Chef Aeverstrone of the\
     Scarlet Moon Court*

Hello young one! I hope you've come to share in this little old man's love for cooking.\
\
To introduce myself, I am Aeverstrone of Kurivinda, and I have served the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon court[#]() for the last 80 years, serving as head imperial chef, though nowadays I mostly personally cook for the imperial family. Do forgive me if I digress a bit throughout this book, having been around for over 170 years gives you a lot to reminisce over!

\
Ah, wine, what a diverse and vibrant world. This recipe predates me - I know, it may surprise you to hear that there are things older than me, heh - it's a sort of desert wine, popular in my court and used in many recipes you may have seen.\
\
I'll tell you, go easy on it, this stuff hits a lot harder than you'd expect.
*Reminiscent of mead, but closer to an alcoholic nectar.*

\
Emperors and peaches, they are practically inseparable! Those nephrite trees that grow in these regions did not originate here, rather, they are endemic to a land far beyond this one, deep to the east. The love my Emperors have for glass peaches is so great that they've brought them everywhere they've gone - you could map out where they've reigned just by following the nephrite blossoms!
*The Shura have gold, graceless humans have purple, but for us? The color of royalty is pink! Hahahah!*

\
This dish of lizard meat braised in wine and petals is a delicacy, and one that I would not blame you if you got it wrong the first 2 or 20 times you cooked it. To this day it remains one of the difficult dishes I cook regularly, it is a protracted process involving many delicate ingredients. But the result is something truly wonderful.
*Honestly, I never remember how to spell its name.*

\
The humble Junket, variants of this sweet, glutinous snack exist in all forms, though this one is a particularly eccentric one! I honestly do not enjoy preparing these very much, extracting the oils from the petals is a long and tedious process, but the children of the court always get so excited when they see the stuff - it makes my old heart swell.

*Imperator Aava loved this when he was a wee leveret.\
\
I'm pretty sure the goober still does.*

\
I have a fun story tied to this recipe. Koi, in addition to being gorgeous creatures, make for the basis of some of the most unique and stunning imperial recipes. These recipes however often require odd and exotic ingredients, and one day we were clean out the night before a banquet. Thinking swiftly, I swapped out the ferment for [mother of moor](entry://general/fading), resulting in this flower-like dish.
*Don't let this ferment for too long or the mother is going to start eating away at the fish!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.improved_critica:
I noticed that I deal significantly more damage to enemies when I jump while attacking.\
\
To further improve these jump attacks, I have reated this enchantment, which increases the additional damage even more.

Additional damage when dealing crits.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Sharpness.
book.spectrum.guidebook.incandescent_ama:
*The sun on the palm of my hand* sounded far better in theory. \
\
Now that it sits there... well, it burns. The very fact that it exists is almost a miracle - really, it should have exploded in the barrel - an unstable, simmering amalgam of ethanol blended with a cocktail of accelerants that hates existing.

One false move could easily cause it to detonate, taking everything nearby with it, including me. And yet, for all these reasons and more, the soft, warm glow of the gel elicits endless curiosity. All things are drawn to the flame.\
\
There is no question that what is effectively a high-yield magical explosive bears endless potential. All I need is a little care, a small mountain of it, and a touch of reckless abandon.
The longer the synthesis goes on, the higher the yield... I really can't blame the angels for not wanting their share of this.
The amalgam's pristine burn makes it uniquely suited to Pure Alcohol distillation
book.spectrum.guidebook.indestructible.p:
I've come this far, and yet I still have to contend with the fact that my common tools, such as [#](bb00bb)Flint and Steel[#]() tend to break if I use them too often. And I have more than my fair share of equipment that was previously too fragile to be used for long.\
\
Now, with some inspiration from my full armada of nearly indestructible items? No problem.

Makes a tool fully unbreakable.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all damageable tools, with some single exceptions.\
Mutually exclusive with Unbreaking, Mending, Efficiency, Infinity, Protection & Curse of Binding.
book.spectrum.guidebook.inertia.page0.te:
I'd almost think this enchantment breathes a little life into my tools.\
\
Like a living creature, the tool gradually gets used to the block that I'm mining and specializes in it. The trade-off is that it becomes slower at mining other blocks when switching.
book.spectrum.guidebook.inertia.page1.te:
Reduced mining speed. Speed picks up with each block of the same type mined.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Efficiency.
book.spectrum.guidebook.inexorable.page0:
I've come a long way and there are few things that can still stop me, except for the Ocean Temples with mining fatigue, slowness, mining underwater, when I am flying the air and other adverse conditions...\
\
*Hm, written out like this, that was a bit more than expected*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.inexorable.page1:
Prevents mining speed slowdowns (on tools) or movement slowdowns (on chestplates).\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools and chestplates.
book.spectrum.guidebook.infused_beverage: Infused Beverages

Brewing is art!\
There is so much to vary and try out that I probably won't finish trying out all the possible combinations in my lifetime.\
They not only differ in their taste, but also in their effects.
A strong flavor, enhanced by the influence of the colored wood. Grants [#](449900)Absorption[#]() and [#](449900)Resistance[#]().
The high sugar content in honey is perfect for fermentation. The result is a strong, but still sweet drink.
Fermented apples, usually sweet and sparkling, with a slight sour note - if I do not forget to tap it soon enough.
Much stronger compared to their common counterparts. Won't go bad over time and taste glorious.
A much more fruity cider than the apple one. The glowy variant seems to ferment a bit faster, but also... makes me glow. Hmm.
Berries can also be used to make liqueur. Way more viscous, sweet and strong, but takes longer to ferment.
*Liquid Luck*
Only gets stronger with age. Just one question: How deadly do I want it to be today?
Only gets stronger with age. Tastes like a bar fight.

Wonderfully light in the mouth. A soft, sweet burn, which lets me forget my worries for a bit. In return, the things that worry me will forget me for a bit, too.\
\
*Tastes like walking on the moon.*
More spicy than it looks.
An interesting combination of all things Deeper Down. Best drunk while still hot!
Filling and tastes both sweet and savory. What a lovely combination.
Sweet with a cinnamon finish
In addition to Haste it can grant a bit of Saturation, depending on how long it fermented.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
Made from [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth), grants [#](449900)Luck[#]() and [#](449900)Haste[#]().
...and a special variant
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.name: Ink
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page0.text:
Now that I'm familiar with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment), I see no reason to lug it around like in the Middle Ages. I have found a way to convert [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) into a higher form of energy!\
\
I called it **[#](5bffed)I[#](aa32a0)n[#](eded00)k[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page1.text:
[Pigment](entry://general/pigment) can be converted to Ink using the [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) and then extracted into containers like an [Ink Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask).\
\
The only drawback: deprived of its physical form, there is no way to reverse this transformation.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page1.title: Producing & Storing
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page2.text: Ink behaves a bit like gas. It flows from where it is abundant to where there is little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page2.title: Transfer
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink.page3.text:
\
When two objects that store Ink are connected - like when putting in an [Ink Flask](entry://ink/ink_flask) into a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) - the Ink between the two will slowly equalize.\
The larger the difference, the faster the Flask is filled.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ink_assortment.p: This collection of small vials allows me to store all kinds of [Ink](entry://ink/ink), albeit only small amounts of each.
The Ink Flask holds a considerable amount of [Ink](entry://ink/ink) of a single color.
I can fill it in the [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker).
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.descriptio: About the mod and how to get started
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.name: Intro
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page0.text: Spectrum is a progression and exploration-driven magic mod where you combine colors.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page1.text:
You will be tinkering with color mixing in the subtractive color system (CMYK). You may be familiar with subtractive color mixing from watercolor painting or printing.\
\
The main colors of the spectrum are represented with gemstones, you can find in geodes scattered around the world, with the vanilla Amethyst representing Magenta.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page2.text:
Spectrum features a unique progression system where you unlock new things as you progress.\
As you progress, you will notice changes in the world. Differences that only *you* personally can perceive.\
\
Everything you learn will bring you closer to your ultimate goal: to find out what lies beneath the impenetrable bedrock floor.
book.spectrum.guidebook.intro.page3.text:
No idea on how to progress? Take a look at this book or your advancements. These give a lot of hints on what to do next. Press the (x) or right mouse button to get started!\
\
Spectrum is still in development. If you find a bug or have a suggestion, visit Spectrum's Discord or report them on GitHub.\
Have fun!        - DaFuqs
book.spectrum.guidebook.inventory_insert:
If I got a [#](bb00bb)Dirt Block[#]() whenever I mined an ore and it fell right into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), I'd have a whole lot of [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#]().\
No idea what I would do with that much, to be honest. Give it to a friend who has just arrived here and needs shelter on his first night?\
\
Anyway, the dropping stuff into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() thing has to stop. I haven't forgotten about you, [#](bb00bb)Ghast Tears[#]().

Puts broken blocks and mob drops directly into the inventory instead of dropping them onto the ground.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools, shears, weapons, bows, crossbows and Spectrum's fishing rods.
book.spectrum.guidebook.item_bowl.name: Item Bowls
There's always something I forget when I leave my base... perhaps placing it in this decorative bowl will serve me as a good reminder?\
*Probably not*\
\
I made both [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() variants.
Displays a single stack floating above it.\
Items can be put, or thrown into it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.item_detector.pa:
The Item Detector is used to count items lying on the ground within a 10 block radius.\
\
The strength of the [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() depends on how many items are lying around.
64 items result in a maximum strength signal.
book.spectrum.guidebook.item_roundel.pag:
I immediately took a liking to the rotating roundels in those ancient structures, so much so that I copied their design. Definitely a nice way to present or store my items.\
\
*Hopefully the patents have already expired.*
The basalt and calcite variants I cobbled together hold up to six stacks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page0:
The remaining energy of this plant from eons ago is barely still perceptible. So featherweight and fragile that I feel any false move could breathe the last bit of life out of this fragile bulb.\
\
*Will the history of this plant remain elusive to me forever?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page1:
Once almost a lost cause, I now have an ace up my sleeve:\
With the help of the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller) I'm sure I can breathe some life back into the little deadish bulb.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page2:
Pallid, fragile but beautiful hanging plants, twining down wooden fences with generous space underneath.\
[#](8f2121)Not used to intense light after all these eons, they will die if exposed to too much sunlight.\
[#](98ff37)They only grow one stage a night and only when exposed to the much softer, indirect light of the moon.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page3:
As I exposed one of the plants to strong sunlight, I found that it had withered. Not only did this withered shrub leave me now only with new Bulbs, but also with this gel-like jelly, though!\
\
*Unexpectedly tasty*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page4:
When Jade Jelly is heated blazingly fast and then cooled down again, the result is a very viscous but sugar-sweet mass.\
\
*Fancy a sugar rush?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page5:
Shiny petals can be plucked when partially grown.\
They can be used for decoration and rarely, I can find [#](449900)another Bulb[#]() when searching through the petals.\
\
What will Jade Vines look like when I let them grow further, tough?
book.spectrum.guidebook.jade_vines.page6:
After many full moon nights, the plants reach full bloom. I was able to gather collect some nectar from their blossoms by using a [#](bb00bb)Glass Bottle[#]().\
Bears great restorative properties:
- can be drunk for healing
- able to repair any damaged item.
Since the [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines) are notorious for their restorative properties, it's no wonder they translate perfectly when fermented.\
In contrast to the slight bitterness of the bulbs, adding a good portion of petals brings out a more floral and slightly tart flavor, complemented by earthy undertones - almost resembling wine, in their characteristic jade color.
[#](bb00bb)1 Bulb[#]() and [#](bb00bb)3 Petals[#]() for the [#](bb00bb)Bucket of Water[#]() feel like a good starting point.\
The longer the fermentation goes on, the stronger the taste gets.\
\
*A bit of [#](bb00bb)added sweetness[#]()* would do it good, I'm sure.
Adding a drop of [#](bb00bb)Moonstruck Nectar[#]() made the wine much easier to drink. The fermentation process is accelerated and negative effects are noticeably mitigated.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jadeite.name: Jadeite
book.spectrum.guidebook.jadeite.page0.te: Imposing vines hang from the high ceiling, breaking the darkness with their light. They are very tasty and can be used as [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
book.spectrum.guidebook.jadeite.page1.te: They are very tasty and can be used as [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
book.spectrum.guidebook.jeopardant.page0:
Adrenaline does not have to be the only thing racing through my veins in a state of emergency.\
\
With every heart lost, the [Stratine Gem](entry://general/stratine) in this ring glows brighter and brighter, pulsing in sync with my racing heart - providing an exponential damage boost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.jeopardant.page1:
*Tell me what you think about your situation\
Complication, aggravation*
book.spectrum.guidebook.karak_chai.page0:
While its soporific notes have taken most of my attention, the pacifying qualities of [Nightdew Sprouts](entry://general/nightdew_sprout) also demand some love.\
Boiling the leaves isolates the calming magic of them, but the infusion ends up being very astringent. However, after doing some taste testing, mixing it with condensed milk and a blend of spices masks the flavor for me completely!
book.spectrum.guidebook.karak_chai.page1: *Creamy tea? I guess there are worse things...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.kindlings.name: Kindlings
Those grand skeletons that dot the depths... even in death, the dragons carry so much might and life to them, there must be some way to restore their splendor through these [Dragonbone Chunks](entry://creating_life/dragonbone@dragonbone_chunks).\
\
Maybe I can become the one to restore the age of divine dragons?
*My own personal fierce dragon. This will be great.*
*So much for my plans for a personal Jurassic Park. Perhaps a petting zoo would be more appropriate?*\
\
The result is definitely not quite as... fierce... as I imagined. Normally I'd say I'm used to failure by now, but with this result who am I to complain?
Their down looks more than soft. *Maybe if I sneak up on one with [Shears](item://minecraft:shears), I can cut off a feather or two?*
This night alchemy I've discovered... it seems to interact in strange ways with willpower. If dragons are beings of pure will, then surely something would happen if the two interacted with each other.\
\
*I can't imagine a little nap would hurt them. But... given their track record, maybe I should do this far away from anything I care about.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.knowledge_gem.pa:
Picking up one of those little green orbs that appear whenever I kill an enemy makes me smarter - supposedly.\
\
However, inevitable death by clumsiness means that I always quickly lose this experience again. Crystallized and safely stored in my chest, however, it will be as safe as can be.
Holds up to 10,000 experience. Enchanting it with [#](449900)Efficiency[#]() increases this limit, [#](449900)Quick Charge[#]() boosts the transfer speed of XP.
Putting a Knowledge Gem in a [Black Hole Chest](entry://magical_blocks/black_hole_chest) will allow it to absorb XP orbs and store the experience in the gem.
book.spectrum.guidebook.koi.page0.text: A pale, large and hearty fish that feels most at home in puddles of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal).
book.spectrum.guidebook.lagoon_rod.page0:
Spending quiet days on my patio I have noticed that marine life seems to be strangely attracted to the [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush) I found earlier. Since they naturally float on water, I decided to use one as a bobber.\
\
Lo and behold, not only does it increase my success, but it also has a number of other interesting side effects...
book.spectrum.guidebook.lagoon_rod.page1: *I wonder what I can bring to the surface.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.laurels_of_seren:
The idea of being left alone is great! What isn't so great is having my tongue go numb from drinking leaf juice every fifteen minutes. The solution to my problems is self evident, simply wear the nightdew!... and pump it full of purple ink.\
\
*Wait - since this is made from the flowers, does that make it a lei?*

Infuse it with [Purple Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) to increase stealth.\
\
*~ The sleep resistance is complimentary ~*
book.spectrum.guidebook.lava_gliding.pag: [#](449900)Increased my movement speed and visibility in Lava[#]() with each level.

However, it did **NOT** protect me from damage by fire or lava.\
\
*Cries out for a slapstick sketch at my expense one day, doesn't it?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.lava_sponge.page:
When I held a [](item://minecraft:wet_sponge) in my hands, I thought naturally there must be a counterpart for [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), too. Although I haven't stumbled upon one yet, that hasn't stopped me from inventing one.\
\
This should make navigating the depths of the world and beyond that hellish portal much easier.

...or so I thought, until I realized that the lava-soaked sponge also has an *unfortunate* side effect.\
I should have guessed.
The Lava Sponge can be used as highly efficient fuel in the [Furnaces](item://minecraft:furnace), drying in the process.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lesser_potion_pe:
Potions are handy. Carrying half an inventory of them around, however, is not.\
The Potion Pendant has a small chamber that can be filled with a potion. As long as I wear it and have Ink on me, I will receive the effects of that potion.\
\
Since the potions are not ingested, the effects only work up to level III.
book.spectrum.guidebook.life_drain.page0:
Life Drain is a horrible thing that turned my stomach around the first time I had it.\
It slowly [#](449900)lowered my maximum hit points[#](), leaving me very vulnerable even to even minor hits.
book.spectrum.guidebook.light_level_dete:
[#](bb00bb)Daylight Detectors[#]() are imprecise when it comes to measuring light: the [](item://minecraft:quartz) they use is so crudely processed that only sunlight can reliably trigger it.\
Amethyst is much more sensitive when it comes to measuring light.\
\
Even the dim glow of a [](item://minecraft:torch) is enough to produce a decent reading.
The Block Light Detector responds not only to sunlight, but also to other light sources, such as light-emitting blocks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lightweight.page:
[#](449900)Makes me a bit lighter[#]() with each level, allowing me to jump further and fall slower.\
High levels even made me take [#](449900)no more fall damage[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.liquid_crystal.p: The pure energy of gems in liquid form. Seems to have a healing effect.
Bringing it in contact with other liquids results in various materials with interesting properties.

Letting Liquid Crystal collide with [Liquid Mud](entry://magical_blocks/mud) creates [#](bb00bb)Clay[#]()! Surely there are more combinations to be discovered!\
\
*Thomas had never seen such an imbalance before.*

Allowing an entire block of Liquid Crystal to absorb the immense heat of Lava resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [](item://minecraft:magma_block), albeit way hotter.

When [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() flowed into a full block of Liquid Crystal, the crystal solidified.\
Since even the slightest touch was enough to give me a cold shiver, I named it Frostbite Crystal.
book.spectrum.guidebook.liquid_crystal_e:
Allowing an entire block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) to absorb the immense heat of [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() resulted in this.\
Almost feels like a [#](bb00bb)Magma Block[#](), albeit way hotter.

[Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing) [#](bb00bb)Blazing Crystal[#]() gave me this searing hot essence that almost sets my hand on fire when I touch it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Magma Blocks[#]() also seems to work, albeit with far less yield.

When [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() touched a source block of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal), the crystal turned solid.\
Since even a light touch is enough to give me a cold shiver, I fittingly named it Frostbite Crystal.

[Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing) [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Crystal[#]() gave me this ice-cold essence that almost freezes my hand just by holding it. Crushing [#](bb00bb)Ice[#]() also seems to work, too, albeit with far less yield.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lizards.name: Lurking Lizards
book.spectrum.guidebook.lizards.page1.te:
Quarrelsome beasts, always looking for trouble.\
\
Actually, they'd be kind of cute if they weren't always trying to bite off my limbs.\
...maybe I'd better keep them behind a [#](bb00bb)Glass Pane[#]() - my extremities will thank me for it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lizards.page2.te: Not particularly tasty and quite chewy, but when I am particularly hungry it does the job.
book.spectrum.guidebook.lucky_roll.page0:
Will I become a pastry chef on top of my main job as an artist? These don't even look too bad (taste good too!).\
\
Composed of [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth), [Milk](item://minecraft:sugar), [Milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket), and a [Four-Leafed Clover](entry://general/clover), I noticed a very special effect: I was a little bit more successful handling tools with Fortune, Looting and other random-based things.
book.spectrum.guidebook.magic_annulation:
[#](449900)Reduced incoming magic damage[#]() by 1 point per level.\
While minor damage was less dangerous to me, big hits still very much posed a threat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.malachite.name: Malachite
A pristine material that sparkles in a deep green hue. It seems to have strong magical properties, almost like a Deeper Down analog of [Azurite](entry://general/azurite). In another similarity to [Azurite](entry://general/azurite), Malachite also needs to be refined. I first have to grow the small fragments I found into full, usable crystals - though I'm not sure I'll see them fully grown in my lifetime, since I didn't find a budding block for them.
The [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) seems to be the only way to grow it, serving as a budding block alternative. I found [Moonstone](entry://general/moonstone_shards) to be a prerequisite, as it creates an environment that mimics the Deeper Down.
[Malachite](entry://dimension/malachite) as a material seems perfect for tools, best compared to [#](bb00bb)Diamond[#](), but much easier to combine with other materials.\
\
These combinations are where the fun begins, allowing for some uniquely intricate tools.

I have created the perfect [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool)!
- Sneak+Use to switch between [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() and [#](449900)Fortune[#]()
- able to mine large tunnels at once and able to [#](449900)strip[#](), [#](449900)till[#]() and [#](449900)flatten[#]().

Its sheer size allows me to hit enemies from a greater distance with ease.\
\
*If it weren't for the [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), I probably wouldn't even be able to lift it.*

A true powerhouse when dealing with aquatic creatures.\
\
*It may only have two prongs compared to a [#](bb00bb)Trident[#](), but I made them twice as pointy instead!*
Shoots projectiles at much higher speed and precision compared to a mundane [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.melochites_cookb: Melochites Cookbook Vol. 1
Melochites Cuisine

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook who has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your Aunt Malaya. Together, we will delve into some gorgeous traditional recipes from my corner of the deep that I hope you will love~!\
\
  *~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*

\
Hearty, filling, and invigorating - Banyash may very well be the backbone of Melochites!\
This simple dish of crawfish is a bit of a favorite of mine, though the recent state of the surface has made access to sweet berries somewhat difficult. Nonetheless, it remains the choice of malachite miners for good reason!
A Sweet, Woody Stew
*A sweet and savory Banyash, with notes of the woods. Made with crawfish and love~*

\
Young hare is a delicacy not just here in Melochites, but in almost any place where Dreitons roam. If you get the chance, please, *please* try using an artisanal azurte stout in this recipe. That kind of beer is only made in a sparse few areas of Melochites but trust me, hard as it may be to get, it is life changing with rabbit.
Hearty Roast with Beer
*While a malt beer is traditional, any good, artisanal brew will do*

\
Feeding an entire group of people is no easy feat, but it is something that every mother has had to deal with on the regular, I can tell you that much myself. This meatloaf recipe has been passed down, doe to kit, in my family for generations - just thinking about how my mom used to cook it makes me tear up a bit... I hope that you will pass it down onto your own children, too.
Loaf for a Family

*A lovely way to feed your own nieces and nephews...\
\
You are planning to feed a family, right?*

*Much more suitable for a single person.\
Though admittedly, it is still too big to fit in me.*
Stuffing Buns with Meat
*For the really freaky among you. Really takes your breath away.*
Fermented Fish
Melochites Cookbook Vol. 2
Melochites Desserts

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook that has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your Aunt Malaya. Together, we will explore some wondrous dessert and drink recipes from my home region, which I hope you'll enjoy~!\
\
  *~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*

\
Believe me or not, Glass peaches are not only good with hearty food, but are also suitable for desserts. Try it out! With even more sugar than these parts already have preserved in the jar, this jam gives you a proper kick and whistles vigorously through your arteries.
Sugar Rush
*So sweet it will color your blood orange.*

\
While Melochites may be best known for the amount and quality of malachite it exports, I can tell you there is much more to this lovely place I call home. The breweries and distilleries nestled in this corner of the caves are nothing short of wonderful, and the lovely liquors they make have resulted in the creation of a lot of cocktails and drinks!
Creamy Shots
*Leaves you feeling cozy inside*

\
Oh, graces, of all the wonders of the surface, I can tell you none compare to the delightful cacao and chocolate.\
\
If there were one thing that could compel me to permanently move out and up, it would be those two, they are truly wonderful, and if you disagree with me, I assure you this recipe will make change your mind.
Plump and Chocolatey
*If there is any proof that the Shura are still watching over us and life is good, this is it.*

\
You know, sometimes it is easy to get caught up in the details of things, in nuance and long recipe lists.\
Sometimes, simpler is better,and this lovely pastry is a prime example of that; milk, flour, butter, and sugar, that is all you need - don't let those stuck up Imbrifer gourmets tell you tell you otherwise!
A Dessert Tart

*Sweet, crispy and delicate.*\
\
*Goes great with tea!*

\
A lot of people would say that us of Melochites are mighty eaters, and admittedly we do tend to be a bit plump.\
\
But, be honest nephew, if you lived in a place with a culinary tradition as rich as what I've shown you, wouldn't you get a bit peckish too? At any rate, I think a lot of you lovely readers appreciate my plumpness...
Stuffed Treat!
*A pound of eggs, a pound of sugar, a pound of flour, and a pound of cream.*
*Aunt Melaya*
book.spectrum.guidebook.memories.name: Memories
book.spectrum.guidebook.memories.page0.t:
Thanks to the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller), I was finally able to breathe new life into a once dead creature!\
It will materialise in an ethereal form at first, which I called a *Memory*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.memories.page1.t:
To remember a creature's memory, I need its [Head](entry://creating_life/mob_heads), as well as its most beloved item and [Vegetal](entry://general/vegetal) as a bonding agent.\
Using [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) seems to completely overwhelm the creature's energies, rendering the resulting Memory unrecognizable, until the memory manifests.
book.spectrum.guidebook.memories.page2.t:
Memories take a certain amount of time to manifest, almost like an egg: I have to place it down and wait. Depending on the creature, it can be fairly quick, or it can take forever.\
\
*Placing Memories on certain blocks seems to speed up the process or stop it altogether.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.memories.page3.t: Thanks to my vast knowledge, I can now resurrect even powerful creatures, such as Ender Dragons, Withers and Wardens.
book.spectrum.guidebook.memory_to_head.p:
Cutting off creatures' heads is not exactly the English way. And not one that is known for particularly low animal cruelty. Nor the most efficient. Let's just say it exists.\
I like this new method here much better. What was I thinking, back then?
book.spectrum.guidebook.mermaids_brush.p:
Mermaid's Brushes are an inconspicuous plant I found growing in the deepest depths of oceans, forever untouched by human influence.\
\
They grow a single blossom, which slowly develops into a pearl-shaped seed. When fully grown, these hollow seeds float to the surface to be carried away by the waves.

These seeds can be planted to grow another plant.\
\
Mermaid's Gems have a strong bond with water - obviously.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mermaids_jam.pag:
A special kind of [Cheong](entry://cuisine/cheong) made from [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush).\
\
The recipe didn't win me over mainly with its flavour, that's for sure (especially not without eating something with it).
But it does impress with the additional effect of water breathing.

*Tastes like the ocean*\
\
Not as sweet as the other ones, but still, very tasty. It has a light note of salt.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mermaids_popcorn:
You know, these little seedlings of Mermaids Brushes are actually quite tasty. Of course I had to try them.\
Getting them out of their shells is always a pain, though (just like my shy friends!).\
Then I heated them up really strongly until the pressure from the inside caused the shell to burst all by itself.\
\
*Crunchy*
*I could eat a whole bag in one sitting while watching my mob farm work.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.midnight_aberrat:
*This abomination of a gemstone radiates an eerie aura.*\
\
It looks loosely connected at best. No wonder it falls apart in my hands in no time. Total failure. Diary, I am both *devastated* and disappointed in myself.

While the chaos that ensued was *definitely* not the result I craved for, the result does indeed hold immense power.\
So much so that it will crumble to dust if not used quickly.\
\
And then there is that aggressive blackish fluid that manifested in the process. Because of its color I named it [Midnight Solution](entry://general/midnight_solution).
book.spectrum.guidebook.midnight_chip.pa:
Creatures that die in Midnight Solution drop a small splinter almost resembling [Midnight Aberration](entry://general/midnight_aberration), only much, much smaller, sharp-edged, and vicious.\
\
Creatures unalived by this gruesome process also seem to [#](449900)drop items as if they were killed by a player[#]().
The very drop I get from killing creatures with this feisty liquid enables me to make even more of it. Quite morbid, when I think about it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.midnight_solutio:
This bizarre liquid is a direct result of [my failed fusion experiment](entry://general/midnight_aberration). Pity, really, but look what I have now.\
\
Creatures that touch it seem to have their lives sucked out of them. Interesting...\
Better not get caught in it myself.
A seemingly useless block that forms around pools of Midnight Solution.
Throwing some items into the liquid seems to corrupt them to the point where they change into something else entirely.
When I throw enchanted items into it, they will lose their special abilities. All that's left is the normal item and a bunch of experience.
book.spectrum.guidebook.milky_resin.page:
This caramel-colored sap has a sweet aroma and a surprisingly luxurious taste! I can use it in the same way as milk, it just needs a little bit of fermenting first.\
\
*The resin itself is tasty as well, but too sticky to drink on its own.*
*~ A pinch of sugar and a little love, and tada - [Clotted Cream](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel#4)! ~*
By using the [Treasure Hunter](entry://enchanting/enchantments/treasure_hunter) enchantment I was able to get a Mob Head.\
\
While they make for a nice display on my wall, they also still inherit a small spark of the creature's existence.
"Any technology advanced enough is indistinguishable from magic," I once heard.\
I'm still not entirely sure how this system manages to store so many blocks in such a small space, but since I regularly walk around with hundreds of square metres of dirt, I've never bothered to question it.
Looks like the [#](bb00bb)Crystal Growth Accelerator[#]() can speed up the growth of all kinds of Gemstone Buds!
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary) is able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]().
Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) are able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Budding Quartz[#](), they even retain their *flawless* state.

Many of AE2's items can be [crushed to dust with an Anvil](entry://general/item_crushing): [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#](), [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#](), [#](bb00bb)Skystone[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Ender Pearls[#]().
In desperate need of [#](bb00bb)Charged Certus Quartz[#]()? [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones) will charge them up in a heartbeat.
...and then create [#](bb00bb)Fluix[#]() out of it, if I get impatient.
As crystalline structures, [#](bb00bb)Certus Quartz[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Fluix Crystals[#]() can be grown in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum).
Rock Crystal is a great source of Silicon

Hardened by heat and pressure, beautiful Alloy Forges can be made from calcite and basalt.\
\
Perhaps I will even find more minerals to use on my next adventure. Best to write them all down here.

In addition, some items can be used as special fuel for Alloy Forges, and some ores have increased output when smelted in one.\
\
Tell Noaaan I said hi!
A high-end forge that melts at an incomparable temperature. Low capacity.
An exceptional forge that uses extra pressure to speed up the melting process. Holds a reasonable amount of fuel.
Pure Resources get a nice multiplier when turned into their mundane counterpart.
With a high tier [#](449900)Alloy Forge[#]() I can squeeze quite a bit more [Stratine](entry://general/stratine) out of the raw ore.
...same is true for its sister ore [Paltaeria](entry://general/paltaeria), of course.
A dripping [#](bb00bb)Lava Sponge[#]() contains enough heat to power an Alloy Forge for quite some time.
Also a good heat source for my Alloy Forges.
Quite slow, but packs a *lot* of fuel.
Twice as fast as the Basalt variant, but I have to refuel quite more often.
A high-tier Forge with medium speed and fuel capacity.
A high-end forge with incredible capacity and reasonable smelting speed.
I recently found new materials scattered across the landscape in new, beautiful terrain. I'm sure I can use them in some interesting way.
The [Crystal Apothecary](entry://ink/crystal_apothecary) is capable of harvesting [#](bb00bb)Illunite Shards[#]().

- +1 positive effect
- 50% chance for negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

- +2 positive effects
- +1 negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

- +3 positive effects
- +1 negative effect
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

- +1 positive effect
- +3 negative effects
- makes the potion unidentifiable.\
\
*Do I fancy a gamble?*

- +2.5 potency
- -3 yield\
\
Requires other reagents to increase the yield, otherwise I will end up with nothing...

- +25%% duration
- 15%% chance to add last effect
I found an abundance of colorful flowers growing in small patches in forests and plains! What's up with those? Definitely worth a look tinkering with them and train my brown thumb.
Crushing the flowers may seem a bit unorthodox, but it *did* work. No problem plucking the petals from the flattened blossom afterwards.

Having studied color theory as well as botany, I can definitely see some similarities. The colored flowers, resemble [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees) in more than just one way.\
\
No wonder their petals make a great source of [Ink](entry://ink/ink).
Constructors and Exchanging Staffs are able to pull blocks out of my Black Hole Talisman.
Adding some [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) to magical flowers will make them glimmer.
Applying [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) to mushrooms will color them in the respective color.
Using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) instead of [#](bb00bb)Dye[#]() when crafting [#](bb00bb)Floral Fertilizer[#]() is quite a bit more yielding.
The [#](bb00bb)Black Lotus[#]() is a great source of Mana, no questions asked. However, it can be improved with some [#](449900)Jade Petals[#]().
Those elusive seeds I could only find in chests hidden across the world? Expensive - maybe not even worth the hassle - but I finally found a way to reproduce them.
I can finally harvest Enchanted Soil! [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) is the key.

- creates Lingering Potions & Tipped Arrows
- -25%% potency

Getting lost deep down time and time again has made me carry a bit of [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() at all times, allowing me to mark the way back out. Unfortunately these little pieces of Calcite never last long before they break.
By using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) instead of Dye, the [#](bb00bb)Chalk[#]() provides me with a never-ending supply of markings.
Of course I was able to make [#](bb00bb)Glow Chalk[#]() unbreakable, too.
Oh yeah, *colored* chalk! Of course I haven't forgotten you.

*Souls, Spirits, Cages*\
Now if that isn't a work of shrewd occultism I don't know what is.

Distilled Spirits can be...\
umm... distilled?\
*distilled further?*\
into long-lasting [#](449900)Resistance[#]() Potions.

I'm not even sure how I came up with this recipe anymore.\
Maybe I inhaled a little too much [#](bb00bb)Quitoxic Powder[#]() when combining various ingredients. But the result is interesting, no doubt.

Combining everything I learned as a Spawner expert and Pigment Tinkerer, I was finally able to create my own [#](bb00bb)Mob Spawners[#]()!\
I only need to assign a creature to spawn using the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).

Everywhere it rattles and fizzles, whistles and smokes. An ensemble of assemblage.\
\
Surely some of these machines will come in handy.
[#](bb00bb)Colored Leaves[#]() can be crushed, yielding [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and a higher chance for [#](bb00bb)Colored Saplings[#]().
[Quitoxic Reeds](entry://general/quitoxic_reeds) can be milled into powder.
Milling [Frostbite Crystal](entry://general/crystallisation) will yield a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Frostbite Essence[#]().
Milling [Blazing Crystal](entry://general/crystallisation) will yield a nice amount of [#](bb00bb)Incandescent Essence[#]().

New biomes bring new opportunities. But which ones?\
*Time to find out!*
To an ignoramus, an alchemist might well be mistaken for a magician. Time to get to know the differences - but also the similarities.
This material seems ridiculously powerful for how common it is. That's why I gave it such a funny name. Let's see what I can do with it.
You are not going to believe this, but...

My magical fishing rods allow me to fish lava and end dwelling fish, like the Go Fish fishing rods.\
I can also fish Crates, as long as I am in the open.

While the Deepfry Enchantment cooks fish as usual, I have not found a way to attach lures to rods made with Pigment. However, I am sure I will find a way to enhance these rod later by other means.\
Deepfry on Fishing Rods is mutually exclusive with Foundry.

Unlike my other gems, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() seems to have the ability to power spell casting wands. While this ability has broken my brain on more than one occasion, the results are impressive.\
What else is there?
Hexcasters are seemingly unable to identify minerals other than Amethyst. *Clearly* these cyan-colored leaves have the essence of [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#]()...

By infusing [#](bb00bb)Leaves[#]() with [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#](), [#](bb00bb)Citrine[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Topaz[#](), I get out glistening, colorful [#](bb00bb)Gemstone Leaves[#](). Intriguingly different, yet familiar to my [Colored Trees](entry://general/colored_trees).
I can charge up [#](bb00bb)Amethyst Shards[#]() using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine).

- +15-120s duration. Sometimes more, sometimes less\
\
As I expected, [#](bb00bb)Charged Amethyst[#]() serves as a more potent, but also more fluctuate, [#](bb00bb)Amethyst[#]() reagent in regards to prolonging durations.

These industrious little buggers continuously collect leaves from trees. The results of their work are reflected in their products. While they mainly produce [#](449900)Clay[#](), there may be others...\
\
Shout out to MastroCaleb for this great mod!
The ants produce an almost silk-like material from [#](bb00bb)Jade Petals[#]().
If I shovel a full anthill that has collected leaves from colored trees, I get [#](bb00bb)Dye[#]().
Even better, if I bribe them with [#](449900)Vegetal[#](), I can get pure [#](449900)Pigment[#]() instead.

I am an advancement hunter with style!\
\
With Paginated Advancements, Spectrum's advancements use new, unique frames.
Mark the start and end of an advancement tree: important milestones in my journey.

Advancements that use this slightly modified frame have some sort of unlock attached to them: new recipes, a new revelation or something else (for all you completionists out there!).\
\
Advancements without additional unlocks use the default frame instead.
Indicates that there is a new structure I have to build.
For affairs of heart, which require an extraordinary eye for detail.

Granted for doing something remarkably stupid.\
These are purely optional meme advancements with no unlocks.

Above the hemisphere of the Overworld exists a very different kind of dimension: filled with numerous spheres that float like small planets.\
\
I can reach them by building a portal from [](item://minecraft:packed_ice) (if it hasn't been changed by the modpack).

There I can find numerous resources that are hard to come by in the Overworld: Geode Spheres, Spectrum's ores, and anything else my heart desires - unless I fall off a planet and plummet to my certain death.
Modular tools were always a field I was interested in. Let's see what I can come up with to make my life easier.

There is this new thing, called *Electricity*. I should check that out.\
\
The factory must grow.
The Cinderhearth is great at creating Refined Iron! What a little more heat can do.
I can process most of my magical ores in the Grinder and Industrial Grinder.

Of course I can also grind down Shards, too!\
\
*I hate grind in games*

*Still mining each ore individually? Gravity might make it easier.*\
\
Vein Mining rips out all connected blocks.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.
I took heart... and another and another. Now I've got a whole bunch of them. Exciting, huh.
book.spectrum.guidebook.modular_explosiv:
Highly modular explosives, consisting of:
- an [#](449900)Archetype[#]() (damage entities, destroy blocks, both, or just purely cosmetic)
- and [#](449900)Modifiers[#]() (change the damage type, lighting fire, increased blast radius, damage and much more)

The [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) can combine a Modular Explosive with items that specify Archetype and Modifiers.\
\
I can customize an entire stack of explosives in one go.
A magical mine that primes after a few seconds and explodes on contact, dealing a massive amount of damage. A [Midnight Chip](entry://general/midnight_chip) disarms it.
A multi-purpose explosive, that can be placed on walls and detonated, as well as thrown. Harmless to living beings by default.

- Gunpowder: Destroying Blocks
- Glowstone Dust: Dealing Damage
- Midnight Aberration: Both\
\
I can also combine both separately.

- TNT: Increased radius
- Chorus Fruit: Starry Particles
- Shimmerstone: Placement of invisible lights

- Fire Charge: Fire
- Doombloom Seed: Primordial Fire
- Storm Stone: Lightning Damage
- Neolith: Magic Damage
- Incandescent Amalgam: Incandescent Damage
- End Rod: Greatly increased damage when near the explosion center

- Stratine Fragments: Square block breaking shape
- Four Leaf Clover: Fortune
- Mermaids Gem: Silk Touch
- Ender Pearl: Inventory Insertion

Modular Explosives come with a suitable archetype built-in. However, if I want to change that, I can use the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) to [#](449900)clear Archetype and Modifiers[#]() and start from with a clean slate.
book.spectrum.guidebook.molten_rod.page0:
Orange, representing warmth, can be used to do the most interesting things.\
\
Unlike a normal [](item://minecraft:fishing_rod), this one is a lot more sturdy and can fish where a normal rod fails.
book.spectrum.guidebook.molten_rod.page1:
*Caution, hot!*\
The flaming fishing hook can burn more than just my fingers...
book.spectrum.guidebook.monstrosity.name: Horrors Below?
book.spectrum.guidebook.monstrosity.page: There is *something* lurking in the dark for me, I am sure. Am I going mad? Is it just my nerves?
This powerhouse of an item is capable pf channeling huge amounts of [#](d0d6d7)Ink[#]() with ease. Can be used to enhance the capabilities of equipment and devices.\
\
*A relic of times long past*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.moonstone_geodes:
Bright white shone towards me, almost dazzling down there. I knew right away where I was. Did fate bring me here? It can hardly be coincidence, can it?\
\
[Moonstone](entry://general/moonstone_shards), the last piece of my [big puzzle](entry://general/color_mixing_white).
book.spectrum.guidebook.moonstone_shards:
I was quite simple-minded not so long ago, wasn't I? Thought I knew everything, but that everything was always merely half the truth.\
\
I know better now. This white, pure gem in my hand, shimmering with a soft, warm glow, is a monument to my personal growth.

I have never been remotely omnipotent, never will be. Not with all the magic in the world. Nobody is. But with a little humility, care and support, I can at least get a little closer.\
\
**[#](d0d6d7)Purity.**
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page0.text:
Mud. It is wet mud. Not particularly interesting in itself.\
What is useful is the collision of Liquid Mud with other liquids, such as [#](bb00bb)Water[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](). This will create [](item://minecraft:dirt) or [](item://minecraft:coarse_dirt), respectively.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page1.text: *While a mud bath sounds like wellness, it is not advised. Believe me, I tried.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page2.text:
Some items that come into contact with Mud will tan.\
For example, [](item://minecraft:rotten_flesh) will turn into [hide](item://minecraft:rabbit_hide).
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page3.text:
Others will instead cure.\
[](item://minecraft:wheat) just needs a bit of TLC to become [](item://minecraft:string).
book.spectrum.guidebook.mud.page4.text:
I accidentally dropped a [Four Leaf Clover](entry://general/clover) into Mud.\
I tried to find it to no avail, but in a stroke of luck I did spot a [verdant piece of shell!](item://minecraft:scute)
Whenever I leave my home, I carry half a tool shed with me. Considering the tons of stone I can carry around with me, that's almost negligible. Nevertheless, a universal tool that combines the abilities of a Pickaxe, Axe, Shovel and Hoe would suit me well.
Not as efficient for individual tasks, but much better than having to change tools every three seconds.
book.spectrum.guidebook.myceylon.page0.t:
Using an [#](bb00bb)Axe[#]() or [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool) I was able to peel small, but unexpectedly sturdy pieces of bark off a [Noxshroom](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest). Both unexpectedly sturdy for a mushroom and... tasty.\
\
This Myceylon, as I called it, definitely adds great a flavor to baked goods and drinks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mysterious_locke:
I found this mysterious Locket in a Preservation Chest. It is locked tightly.\
\
It has a strange ornament that resembles a notch, softly glowing a pale white color, a shimmer reminiscent of the moon.

There seems to be something inside. It also has an engraving on its back, but if it resembles a language it's not one I've ever seen.\
\
What is it for?\
Who did it belong to?\
Why was it there?\
\
So many questions.
I noticed that the notch seems to fit perfectly with a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores).

The locket contained a small crystal, bearing a dim, yet warm glow.\
\
While [below the Bedrock](entry://dimension/delving_deeper_down), it vibrates softly as I turn.
book.spectrum.guidebook.natures_staff.pa:
Using the elements of [#](70400d)Nature[#]() and [#](98ff37)Fertility[#](), I have come up with this stroke of genius.\
Bone meal is a joke in comparison - this staff works on a lot of blocks where [#](bb00bb)Bone meal[#]() failed me.
*Point at something you want to see blossom*
Decreases the chance of [Vegetal](entry://general/vegetal) getting consumed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.nectardew_burgeo:
It is natural enough that Nightdew can flower. I did not, however, expect its flower to be... like *this*. The soothing essence of the plant's sprigs has blossomed into a bouquet of sleep magic, deep alike a sea of which I may well be diving too deep. \
\
*...oh, that isn't a friend...*

The rarity of these burgeons has proved to be a problem. There is a solution to that though. The plants are a lot more eager to bloom when sleeping creatures are near...\
This is wrong right? Not the sleep but... something like this *cannot* come by on its own. The roots of this magic run too deep, unto things hidden beneath the water's surface.
book.spectrum.guidebook.neolith.page0.te:
The Obsidian was literally pulverized. Now that's power!\
\
The result was this sturdy reagent.\
\
Very powerful.\
Great success.\
But I am not at my limit yet.
book.spectrum.guidebook.nephrite.name: Nephrite Blossoms
book.spectrum.guidebook.nephrite.page0.t:
Little trees, as big as they get down here. Actually more like a big bush... or giant shrub.\
\
*Eeeeh, details.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.nephrite.page1.t:
Their fruit isn't made of glass, but it shimmers very much as if it were. They are very tasty too!\
Eating one may give me a short burst of [Toughness](entry://brewing/effects/toughness).\
\
They can also be [fermented](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) and [used to brew potions](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_brewing).
book.spectrum.guidebook.night_salts.page:
As much as I would like to work day and night, sleep is ultimately a necessity, and one I have done a poor job of managing. The long nights that accompany discovery and exploration can be really hard on the mind.\
\
\
*Phantoms make sure that it is also rough on the body, too.*

These vials should solve all my problems. One good whiff of the salts inside should knock me out in 10 seconds flat.\
\
*Does this smell like chloroform to you?~*
book.spectrum.guidebook.nightdew.page0.t:
Well then, I guess all things do come around eventually. The mother of all nightdew reveals itself to me, hidden just beneath the bedrock - a fan-leafed vine with silvery wood and a tea-like fragrance...\
\
*...wait, where are it's flowers?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.nightdew.page1.t:
*Every time I get near these I just feel like laying down and taking a long nap.\
Every time I do so, I have strange dreams of barren waters.\
\
...I swear buds appear on the vine when I do so, but they always vanish.*
A curious little sprig reminiscent of tea leaves! Its extracts are pleasantly sweet and ripe with calming qualities. Only thing is that I just can't seem to figure out where to plant it on.\
\
*~ A fragrant little friend ~*
Ahhh. After a lot of careful observation, the way to cultivate these has finally revealed itself to me. These vines are picky, and will only grow on certain natural blocks endemic to the deep.
book.spectrum.guidebook.nightfalls_blade:
This small blade is too fine to inflict serious wounds, but has many sharp thorns that will bore into my opponent's flesh.\
\
When infused in the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop), a struck opponent will be afflicted with the effect - provided I have enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink) on me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.no_milk_pls:
Note to self:\
*Don't even think about drinking tea with [milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket)*
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxshroom_forest: A strange mixture of tree and fungus towers over this biome.
Blackslag, covered with a thin layer of a mycelial fungus.
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxwood.name: Noxwood
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxwood.page0.te:
A type of mushroom - or is it more a tree? - which can be found all over the [Noxshroom Forest](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest). They come in a variety of colors.\
\
The trunks are as firm as wood, while the caps are almost soft and squishy. The bioluminescent gills give off a pleasant glow, which makes them excellent light sources.
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxwood.page1.te: So good, every bite makes me giddy with joy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxwood.page7.te: Sort of like [#](bb00bb)Barrels[#](), but with twice the storage space.
book.spectrum.guidebook.noxwood.page9.te: Can be placed standing or hanging. If I [#](449900)Sneak[#]() I will place an alternate variant.
book.spectrum.guidebook.omni_accelerator:
When I came up with the name for this toy, I really meant it.\
\
The Omni-Accelerator is loaded with items or blocks and can shoot them from a distance - all it needed was a powerful energy source in the form of a [Moonstone Core](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores).\
Blocks are placed and the poor thing hit by flying items receives its effects.
Sharp Dripstone is not the only thing I found useful as a projectile. There are some... *fun*... things I can do with the right ammo.
book.spectrum.guidebook.only_works_when_: Only works while its owner is online.
book.spectrum.guidebook.onyx_shards.name: Creating Onyx Shards
book.spectrum.guidebook.onyx_shards.page:
For Brown Pigment I need to darken Orange.\
**DARK!**\
\
It's so logical now that I think about it! The three gems I found correspond to the three basic colors of color theory!\
By mixing all three, I can create a shard that is so dark it looks almost unreal.

I will have to create the 'blackest of blacks' in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) in a way that absolutely no unregulated light can contaminate the crystal. *So midnight on a new moon it is*!\
\
Best to bring a [](item://minecraft:clock) with me.
Depending on the position of the sun and moon, the moon reflects more or less light.

These are known as [#](449900)Moon Phases[#]().\
\
When the moon is at its brightest, it is called a [#](449900)Full Moon[#](). When at its darkest it is called a [#](449900)New Moon[#]().\
\
An entire lunar phase cycle from one new moon to the next is also called a [#](449900)lunation[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.overchanting.pag:
My experience with both magic and the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) has led me to yet another new discovery:\
[#](449900)Overchanting[#]().\
\
Packing so much magical energy into a single [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() will be expensive. *Very expensive*.

- Clovers' Favor: 3 â 6
- Disarming: 2 â 4
- Exuberance: 5 â 10
- First Strike: 2 â 5
- Improved Critical: 2 â 4
- Inertia: 2 â 5
- Tight Grip: 2 â 4
- Treasure Hunter: 3 â 5
- Sniper: 2 â 4

- Bane of Arthrop.: 5 â 8
- Blast Protection: 4 â 8
- Depth Strider: 3 â 3
- Efficiency: 5 â 8
- Feather Falling: 4 â 6
- Fire Aspect: 2 â 4
- Fire Protection: 4 â 8
- Fortune: 3 â 5
