- Frost Walker: 2 â 4
- Impaling: 5 â 8
- Knockback: 2 â 5
- Looting: 3 â 6
- Loyalty: 3 â 4

- Luck of the Sea: 3 â 5
- Lure: 3 â 5
- Piercing: 4 â 8
- Power: 5 â 8
- Proj. Protection: 4 â 8
- Protection: 4 â 8
- Punch: 2 â 5
- Quick Charge: 3 â 5
- Respiration: 3 â 6
- Riptide: 3 â 4
- Sharpness: 5 â 8
- Smite: 5 â 8
- Soul Speed: 3 â 4
- Sweeping Edge: 3 â 7
- Thorns: 3 â 6
- Unbreaking: 3 â 6
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page0:
Why a *brush* of all things?\
\
Good question, I wondered that myself, after I came up with it. It was mostly intuition, really. There is something about the colorful Pedestal and the bright colors of the crystals that awakened something I now call my inner artist.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page1: Giving the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) a good whack with it will make it start crafting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page2:
What better use is there for [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) than to color with it?\
\
If I [#](449900)crouch with my Paintbrush equipped I can bring up the color selection menu[#]().\
\
After choosing a color all I have to do is slightly touch a colorable block I want to color and the [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) will flow into it and change it to that new color.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paintbrush.page3:
I can use my brush to bundle up Ink and fling it as a projectile.\
\
The surface (or creature!) the projectile hits will be painted as long as it can be recolored, plus dealing a good amount of knockback.
book.spectrum.guidebook.paltaeria.name: Paltaeria
The pale blue color is the hallmark of this ore, found exclusively in small clusters in the End.\
\
Like the End itself, the curious properties of this material are not to be overlooked.
From my previous experience with Paltaeria, I can already guess that it would not be a good idea to place this block outdoors - my future self will thank me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.particle_spawner:
The [Shooting Star](entry://general/stargazing) I saw left a beautiful shower of particles on its way. Fascinated by this spectacle, I created the highly configurable Particle Spawner.[#]()\
A chimney? Rocket launching particles? Atmospheric particle rain for my Pedestal? The Particle Spawner has it all.\
*Maybe I can even be inspired by more particles as I progress!*
I can use its interface to configure the particles to my liking and apply a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() to start the fantastic display.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pastel_network.p:
[#](449900)Hoppers, Minecarts, Pipes[#](), and other such mundane methods of transport are nice, but *lacking*. These Azurite-powered nodes - which I have named the [#](449900)Pastel Network[#]() - are a more elegant and much superior solution to the challenges of logistics.\
\
Due to reasons, the nodes are able to transfer items without line of sight. Another indicator of my natural genius!

While I may be terribly clever, my nodes sadly are not. In fact they are quite stupid, which is an issue when the need for more flexible behaviour arises.\
Luckily, I can harness the fact that these crystals have exactly 0 braincells. By writing an [#](449900)Item Tag[#]() on a strip of vellum, I can trick the nodes into accepting anything within that tag!

Via descriptions, I can make nodes filter for nbt fields. Some extra keywords are available in some cases.\
*Numbers: above, below*\
*Text: is (not) blank*\
*Enchs: with {id} + level (optional)*\
*Durability: (not) damaged*\
*Eg: Durability, Age above 100, Enchantments with minecraft:sharpness above 3*
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.page0.t:
I got inspired by the [gem I found](entry://general/shards). Look at this beautiful thing! The design goes great with every gem of choice.\
\
It resembles a [](item://minecraft:crafting_table), so I can craft normal recipes in it, but this enhanced design might also allow me to create entirely new blocks never seen before!
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.amethys: The magenta makes a beautiful contrast to the wood.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.citrine: Vibrant yellow looks so full of life.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.page2.t:
I placed it down and it did... nothing much.\
\
But I quickly figured out what I was missing: [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) for some oomph as well, a trigger to make it start crafting, like a [Paintbrush](entry://general/paintbrush) or a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() and air or an inventory above it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal.automat:
I can automate the Pigment Pedestal using a [Crafting Tablet](entry://equipment/crafting_tablet).\
When I set a recipe in the tablet and put it into the designated slot of the Pedestal, it will put items hoppered into it directly into the correct spots.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal_customi:
I can exchange the basalt blocks with calcite and choose the gemstone blocks as I like it best.\
\
By mixing [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() I can give the structure my own personal touch.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pedestal_upgrade: Pedestal CMY Upgrade
I now have three gems. *And an idea!* I could upgrade my [Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) with all three types I found! This will make it both prettier and more versatile.
CMY Variant

In order to use the advanced abilities of the [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) I will need a structure to focus energy into it.\
\
I call it the **Spectrum Focus**.
Pedestal Structure
Dimensions: 11x11x4 blocks. But best to leave a few extra blocks of space around, just in case.

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Polished Pillars
- 68 Polished Blocks
Dimensions: 13x13x7 blocks
Moonstone Pedestal
I can upgrade my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) by using a [Moonstone Shard](entry://general/shards@moonstone).

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMYK Chiseled Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 172 Polished Blocks

- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 36 Polished Crests
- 12 Polished Blocks
Moonstone Pedestal (2)

My latest structure feels... lacking. And now I know exactly why: more [#](d0d6d7)Moonstone[#]()! The tricky part: for me being able to create [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Chiseled Blocks[#]() would require me to use the full capabilities of my [#](bb00bb)Moonstone Pedestal[#]() already, but without the finished structure I can't use Moonstone Powder yet.\
*Could there be a way around this? A kickstart, if you will?*

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 4 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 12 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 16 CMY Gemstone Chiseled Bl.
- 28 Moonstone Chiseled Bl.
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 52 Polished Crests
- 144 Polished Blocks
- 28 Moonstone Chiseled Bl.
Pedestal Onyx Upgrade
I can upgrade my [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) by using an [Onyx Shard](entry://general/shards@onyx) to further increase its magical power.
Onyx Variant
Dimensions: 13x13x6 blocks

- 1 Pigment Pedestal
- 8 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 4 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 4 Notched Polished Blocks
- 36 Polished Pillars
- 160 Polished Blocks

- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 16 Gemstone Chiseled Blocks
- 16 Polished Crests
- 28 Polished Pillars
- 92 Polished Blocks
book.spectrum.guidebook.perturbed_eye.pa:
Every time I want to enter the realm of the Endermen, I have to travel half a world. Whoever created the portals to the End... I'm so much more knowledgeable than they are now.\
\
Well, almost.\
I still haven't figured out how to create such portals myself, but packing them up and taking them home? *No problem.*
The End Portal, like found in Strongholds
Due to the extremely sturdy portal frames, these have to be quite destructive. Best to keep a bit of distance after socketing.
All I have to do is put the portal back together the way it was, re-add Eyes of Ender, and done!
book.spectrum.guidebook.pest_control.pag:
On my way to the End I came across a huge underground structure that looked like the fortress of a civilisation that lived far before me.\
\
Although they seemed to have technology that allowed them to open a portal to another world, they definitely should have done something about their vermin problem.

Gets rid of Silverfish when breaking [#](bb00bb)Infested Blocks[#](), dropping double XP.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Resonance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.phantom_frame.pa:
I wanted to display my most precious possessions on my walls and so far, I've always used item frames to do this.\
\
But some of my exhibitions looked better if you don't see the frame, so here we are!
A Phantom Frame becomes invisible as soon as an item is in it.
This one has another nice touch: the item it holds is bathed in bright light, making it look even more impressive.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.name: Pigments
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page0.te:
Finally! I was able to obtain absolutely pure Pigment! I harvested it from the leaves of a [Colored Tree](entry://general/colored_trees), today.\
And by using a hoe the harvest is pretty fast, too.\
These Pigments have a magical feel to them.\
\
I'm still not fully convinced that [all colors](entry://general/color_mixing_cmy) even exist in this form. How many can I find?
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page10.t:
This juicy lime almost smells like a warm spring morning. Or is it just my imagination?\
\
[#](98ff37)Lime[#]() represents *Happiness* and *Fertility*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page11.t:
Soft magenta always puts me in a calm and contented, almost serene mood.\
\
[#](ff4ff6)Magenta[#]() represents *Time*, *Kindness* and *Tolerance*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page12.t:
This orange color reminds me of autumn. Makes me feel a bit like sitting in a comfy armchair in front of a fireplace.\
\
[#](f97b2d)Orange[#]() represents *Warmth* and *Comfort*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page13.t:
This bright, vibrant cotton candy pink makes me beam with joy.\
\
[#](ff9fc6)Pink[#]() represents *Health* and *Admiration*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page14.t:
This sight gets my mind going. It not only stimulates my thirst for knowledge, but also sparks creative ideas.\
\
[#](802bc4)Purple[#]() represents *Wisdom* and *Creativity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page15.t:
I feel the urge and desire to create something beautiful.\
\
[#](f12a34)Red[#]() represents *Passion* and *Willpower*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page16.t:
I cannot put it into words exactly. Staggering, overwhelming, but in a good way. There is something unspeakably wonderful about this Pigment.\
\
[#](d0d6d7)White[#]() represents *LIFE*, *Light* and *Purity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page17.t:
The vibrant yellow is almost bursting with energy.\
\
[#](eded00)Yellow[#]() represents *Energy* and *Joy*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page18.t: I can always craft them back into Pigment.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page2.te:
The darkest material I have ever held in my hands. It looks almost surreal.\
\
[#](302951)Black[#]() represents the nothingness of the *Void*, *Power* and *Mystery*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page3.te:
Holding it in my hand gives me a sense of security. All nonsense of course, after all, it is only a color. But still...\
\
[#](2432ff)Blue[#]() represents *Safety* and *Permanence*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page4.te:
This rich brown makes me long for mother nature.\
\
[#](70400d)Brown[#]() represents *Nature* and *Stability*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page5.te:
Makes me feel like I am sitting on the top of a mountain, taking in the infinite vastness of this world.\
\
[#](5bffed)Cyan[#]() represents *Matter* and *Integrity*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page6.te:
This color looks to me like the defeated older brother of light gray. Looking at it makes me a little sad, but I am not sure why exactly.\
\
[#](464646)Gray[#]() represents *Evanescence*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page7.te:
This Pigment gently radiates inner peace.\
\
[#](526b0f)Green[#]() represents *Balance* and *Harmony*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page8.te:
I feel a sense of optimism, but also of departure.\
\
[#](7a9eff)Light Blue[#]() represents *Luck* and *Peace*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pigment.page9.te:
Do you know the feeling of sitting serenely, looking at the landscape, feeling life pass you by, and yet everything is okay?\
\
[#](adadad)Light Gray[#]() represents *Change*, but also *Quiet*.
Carrying enough [Ink](entry://ink/ink) to maintain my magical equipment has become both a chore and a space hog in my inventory.\
It's time for a new creation: the Pigment Palette.\
\
*Thematically fitting, isn't it? Now I feel like a real Artist.*
Capable of storing sizable amounts of [Ink](entry://ink/ink), perfect for powering all my magical equipment. Unable to power machines, though.
[Moonstone Cores](entry://dimension/moonstone_cores) burst with energy. It sounds like a very bad idea to discharge one in milliseconds.\
\
*...but sometimes the worst ideas are the best, aren't they?*\
\
Their explosion does not damage blocks, but causes [enormously aggressive fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire).
I know people who build gigantic constructions out of [#](bb00bb)Redstone[#]() just to open an oversized door. And then they trigger it with an unsightly [#](bb00bb)Pressure Plate[#]().\
The Player Detector, on the other hand, is able to sense my presence - or that of other players - from a distance and sends out an appropriate [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().\
\
*Much prettier*.

Radius of 10 blocks.\
Emits a full strength signal, if the player who placed it is detected, otherwise 8.
The Potion Workshop is so much more than a [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](): my biggest change was to use the liquid I found in [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush) instead of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#](), which enabled me to [use magic items as additional reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).\
\
Another great side effect is that I do not have to fill the bottles with water beforehand.
book.spectrum.guidebook.low_yield: *In spite of everything I've tried, this brew has a naturally low yield.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.potion_workshop_:
I was able to replicate all the potions I could do with the Brewing Stand and more! (though some of them are easier or harder to get enhanced effects from)\
\
I can use [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents) to tinker with their effects.
I can make those using the same ingredients as I would in the [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#]().
Using Milky Resin yields a stronger blend at the cost of duration.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Mining Fatigue** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Hunger** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the effect to **Bad Luck** instead.

As the name implies, I designed the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) around the creation of powerful potions.\
But with the help of all of the filigree and granular adjustable switches and valves I found great utility in it for creating other things with it, as well!\
\
All of those recipes do not require [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
Will consume 100 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().
Will consume 10 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().

- +100%% potency
- +100%% duration
- -3 yield
- infused the drink with soporific qualities

- 50%% chance for +1 duration
- 50%% chance for +1 potency
- 50%% chance for +1 yield
- Stat modifiers are inverted for negative effects
- +50%% chance to add the main effect of the potion that was brewed before
- always adds the main effect of the previously brewed potion

Instead of adding ingredients to the potion bit by bit, as in the [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](), I experimented with dissolving all the ingredients in the liquid contained in [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush) all at once and adding some of my magical collectibles as reagents.\
**Breakthrough!**\
\
Each reagent will have an unique effect on the [#](bb00bb)Potion[#]().

- the order in which I arrange the reagents will not matter
- flat bonuses get applied first, percentage-based bonuses modify that value afterwards
- the same reagent cannot be stacked
- converts negative effects to equivalent positive ones
- +50%% potency & +50%% duration to the main effect of the previous potion, if inherited

- +50%% chance to add the main effect of the previously brewed potion
- +100%% potency & -33%% duration to the main effect of the previous potion, if inherited
- dramatically increases potency at the beginning, but makes potency wear off over time quick - will not work for instant effects
- negates the duration penalty for Lingering Potions as well as for Tipped Arrows
- large boost to a random stat
- makes the potion much smoother, making it much quicker to drink

- +1 potency for positive effects
- colors the Potion in a random color

- +100%% duration
- -2 yield
- makes the Potion much slower to drink

- +100%% potency
- -1 yield
- makes the Potion much slower to drink
- +100%% potency and duration to the main effect of the previous Potion, if inherited

- creates Lingering Potions - also requires Gunpowder as a reagent
- allows the creation of Tipped Arrows, if I supply Arrows instead of Bottles
- makes effects not show any particles
- adds a very weird taste and smell to the potion, making it unidentifiable. Also colors it completely black
book.spectrum.guidebook.preenchanted_too:
That stupid obsidian table is being stubborn again when it comes to giving me the enchantments I am looking for. *Yes, I am salty.*\
\
Besides that, my options are to slaughter a whole herd of cows or rob the books of a dozen villages (no wonder the inhabitants there are so stupid and only too happy to be eaten by Zombies).

The advantage of knowing exactly what I want gives me the ability to shape the tools so that they inherently have certain qualities. Color magic makes it possible.\
\
Unfortunately, these features make most of these tools very fragile.

This pickaxe is studded with Topaz to cut even the most delicate material from stone.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](5bffed)Silk Touch[#]()**.

Built with Citrine, it allows me to carve out every last bit of ore from every vein.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](eded00)Fortune III[#]()**.

The short, razor-sharp gemstone blade makes it a deadly weapon.\
Pre-enchanted with **[#](ff4ff6)Looting III[#]()**.
An outlier in the group, the Oblivion Pickaxe has great durability and mining speed. However, all mined blocks [are destroyed](entry://enchanting/enchantments/curse_of_the_void).
[Allows me to keep blocks intact](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) that would otherwise be irreparably destroyed using gentle vibrations.

A real powerhouse of a Pickaxe for when I want to break hard blocks.\
Comes pre-enchanted with [Razing III](entry://enchanting/enchantments/razing).
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page0.te:
The people around me have helped me through some tough situations. It's about time I give something back. A dash of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) causes the package to explode in a colorful shower of particles.\
\
After I click the Present onto the items I want to gift, I have to wrap it and then set it down so the recipient can open it and I can watch them jump for joy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page1.te:
*(Or, you know, I can always gift my future self!)*\
\
Some items have special behavior when unwrapped.
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page2.te:
- Put filled Present in crafting grid to wrap
- Optional: add [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) for a colorful particle shower
- Optional: add a special item to choose a wrapping paper (right)
book.spectrum.guidebook.present.page3.te:
- Red Dye: Red
- Blue Dye: Blue
- Cyan Dye: Cyan
- Green Dye: Green
- Purple Dye: Purple
- Cake: Cake
- Flower: Stripes
- Firework Star: Starry
- Snowball: Winter
- Spore Blossom: Rainbow
book.spectrum.guidebook.preservation_rui:
Deep underground I found this outlandish structure, which seems to be made of immensely sturdy stone. Whoever built it seems to have knowledge far beyond my understanding.\
There must be a way to get in there! If not now, then later... better keep the location in mind.

Until now, I thought I was alone in my creative endeavours. It seems I was wrong. So very, very wrong.\
Whoever built these structures obviously followed a similar path to mine, but was miles ahead.\
Still, anyways. I accept the challenge, of course. I have one huge advantage:\
*I am still alive.*
These structures seem to come in different variations. In each one I seem to encounter a different challenge.
A powerful, magical force field. Wearing [Azure Dike equipment](entry://equipment/trinkets/azure_dike_equipment) allowed me to enter.
It was all so clear in the end! I had it [all figured out already](entry://general/color_mixing_cmy).
A really weird one. Having some colors on hand helped a lot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.preservation_tur: *True engineering excellence. But, boy, does that excellence hurt.*

High-tech machines, consisting of a reinforced shell of Basalt and Calcite, powered by an unknown source of energy that pulsates gently in the heart of these contraptions.\
\
Ready to poke holes in me as soon as I make my presence known.
Much more aggressive than the usual [#](bb00bb)Fire[#]() ignited by [#](bb00bb)Flint & Steel[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Primordial Fire[#]() unleashed by Doomblooms seems to burn with an insatiable, searing heat. Almost as if it consumes matter and soul alike. Terrifying.
Primordial Fire does not seem to draw its energy primarily from matter, but rather burns the soul.
book.spectrum.guidebook.primordial_light:
[Primordial Fire](entry://dimension/primordial_fire) is the devil's stuff. No wonder it eats away at your soul.\
\
Without this glove, I would be very uncomfortable - *I actually quite like my soul*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.projectile_rebou: Each level gave me a small chance of [#](449900)bouncing off incoming projectiles[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.provider_node.pa:
Make the items in the connected inventory available in their [Pastel Network](entry://pastel_network/pastel_network).\
\
Items are not pushed, but can be requested from [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) and [Buffer Nodes](entry://pastel_network/buffer_node).
book.spectrum.guidebook.puff_circlet.pag:
This glistening hoop creates a protective film of air around me.\
\
Grants [#](495b24)4[#]() units of [#](2c2e8e)Azure Dike[#](). Will protects me from projectiles and can cushion a long fall, using some of those charges.\
The Puff Circlet also prevents [#](bb00bb)Farmland[#]() from being trampled.
*Gone are the days of being sniped at from behind by Skeletons.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.pure_alcohol.pag: My memory doesn't always work, it seems. Somehow I ended up with this bottle. Definitely got a *little* stronger than planned...
book.spectrum.guidebook.pure_resources.p:
Growing materials in the [Crystallarieum](entry://ink/crystallarieum) has yielded this: a much purer, crystalline variant compared to [#](bb00bb)Raw Ore[#]().\
\
On closer inspection they almost appear to be surrounded by an almost invisible sheen, gently protecting them from the elements. This shroud seems to be what protects [#](bb00bb)Pure Copper[#]() from oxidation.
Ironically, I found that this same sheen also seems to make them withstand the heat of [Furnaces](item://minecraft:furnace). A [](item://minecraft:blast_furnace) did the job (poorly, but it did!).
Smelting these in the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth) will give me a much more decent output.
Can be crafted back into the corresponding [#](bb00bb)Pure Resource[#]().
It doesn't get much more efficient or risk-free than that.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pyrite.page0.tex: Hard, sharp and yet surprisingly brittle. I found Pyrite all over the [Razor Edge](entry://dimension/razor_edge).
book.spectrum.guidebook.pyrite.page1.tex: Unless [#](449900)silk touched[#](), Pyrite shatters into items, requiring me to combine it again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.pyrite.page2.tex: Inspired by their properties, I designed many decorational blocks. I can [#](bb00bb)craft[#]() them or use the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.pyrite.page3.tex:
*Those sharp things are tearing me apart.*\
\
Well, my clothes, mostly. But still, point stands.
book.spectrum.guidebook.quitoxic_reeds.p:
I found it in a Swamp.\
[#](bb00bb)Seems to devour Clay[#]() as a form of nutrient.

I was able to extract a purple glittering powder from the stems of this alien-looking plant by [crushing it](entry://general/item_crushing)!\
The smell and consistency are very unusual when rubbed between my fingers.\
*...wait a moment, what are fingers?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.radiance_pin.pag:
I didn't name this pin after the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff) by accident - they're quite similar, in a way.\
\
In a dark area, the pin automatically creates invisible lights. However, unlike the lights of the [Radiance Staff](entry://equipment/radiance_staff) they are free, but slowly fade over time.
It's fascinating to see the paths I've already taken when exploring caves.
book.spectrum.guidebook.radiance_staff.p:
Torches have one crucial weakness: I have to get into the dark, before placing them.\
\
In contrast, the Radiance Staff's Light Flood ability can place lights far away and in the air, illuminating large caverns from afar.\
As a final goodie, these lights are invisible, making them great for lighting my builds atmospherically.

Interacting with placed lights using the staff to adjust the light level.\
They can even be summoned underwater.
book.spectrum.guidebook.radiant_glass.pa:
I need a way to efficiently light my shelter and other structures. Pretty much the opposite of [#](bb00bb)Tinted Glass[#]()?\
\
What could be better than using the luminescent properties of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone)? The [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone) used in its manufacture ensures that the glass glows from within.
Those pesky Endermen!\
\
They always come out at night and steal blocks off the ground right in front of my house. I have a feeling this whole area will be nothing but a crater in a month.

The Endermen come to this world to place down these blocks. *What is this stuff*? And *WHY* are they leaving them here?\
\
Now that I hold one in my hands... they are everywhere! How didn't I notice earlier? Anyway, I'm sure that I can make use of this interesting material somehow.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rare_intact_gem: Rarely, I find an intact gem, usable in recipes for which fragments are too small. With some effort, these fragments can also be made whole again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razing.page0.tex:
Even with a list of enchantments that I can barely read anymore due to its length, there are still a few blocks that escape my gaze of superiority.\
\
[#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), you will be getting cancelled today.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razing.page1.tex:
Higher mining speed the harder a block is to break.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Fortune.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razor_edge.page0: Everything here seems to thrive on stabbing me. Not the most welcoming place to be.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razor_edge.page1: Even the ground: Parched and razor-sharp from lack of light and water - hence the name.
book.spectrum.guidebook.razor_edge.page2: Small mean plants that sting immensely when I make contact with them.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_calcula: Using the red math dust from underground, I've built gigantic constructions, just to emulate a parrot's ability to calculate. When I look at them, my breath literally stops (*and the rest of the world, too, several times a second*). The energy-laden [Citrine](entry://general/shards@citrine) seems perfect for cramming basic arithmetic logic into a very small space.
Modes: Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Modulo, Min and Max. First input is the back, second is the highest signal on the sides.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_interac: When I expose a [#](bb00bb)Pastel Node[#]() to a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](), it loses the link to its attached inventory.

- [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) will stop requesting items
- [Provider Nodes](entry://pastel_network/provider_node) will be unable to offer their items
- [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) will stop emptying their inventory
- [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node) will be unable to accept and offer their items
- [Buffer Nodes](entry://pastel_network/buffer_node) will stop requesting and offering items

While the built-in redstone functionality of [#](bb00bb)Pastel NodeS[#]() is nice, certain situations have proven to require specialized control. The pure resources I recently learned about seem to have qualities suitable to such a task.

Pure Redstone is, rather predictably, an excellent way to power things. Applying this to a node will force it to always be on.\
\
*Cinnabar Dream*

Sometimes I just need to invert signaling but there is not enough space to flip things around. Pure Coal will do that without any additional space or mess.\
\
*Black is the new Red*

Echo is a really curious thing, and one I've honestly had trouble finding a use for. It seems its sonar qualities are excellent for detecting items passing by a node, producing an ephemeral redstone pulse.\
\
*Resonance Cascade*

There are cases where I want to have a node be just permanently disabled, Lapis does just that. It is great for, well\
I can go ahead and\
Well it could be the case that\
\
*Why did I make this?*

Fine control over the flow of transmissions bears some utility. Through the use of Pure Quartz I can make it so the node will only activate when pulsed by redstone, where it will send one packet.\
\
*One Step at a Time*

Making these things glow is quite nice, but if I ever want to use one as a bedside lamp I need it to be able to turn off. Pure Glowstone achieves that, turning off when powered with redstone.\
\
*Comparatively Overpriced*
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_sand.pa:
Thinking back to the good old days when I would set little traps for my friends: if they touched the wrong block, they would be completely buried in sand. Today my friends are not so easily fooled anymore.\
\
Modern problems require modern solutions.
Behaves like a solid block until it receives a [#](449900)redstone signal[#](). The [#](449900)redstone pulse[#]() propagates through connected blocks, making them fall.
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_timer.p:
While there are many ways to calculate time, most of them seem relatively... rustic.\
\
They are no match for this new trick up my sleeve: the time affinity of [Amethyst Shards](entry://general/shards@amethyst).
I can toggle the duration of both the active time (interacting) and the inactive time (sneak-interacting with empty hands).
book.spectrum.guidebook.redstone_transce:
Gentle resonances are amplified by [Onyx](entry://general/shards@onyx) to such an extent that they can be measured even through walls, given a suitable receiver.\
Based on my previous experiments with [Gemstone Shards](entry://general/shards), it was easy for me to devise such transmitter and receiver systems.\
Range: 16 blocks.
Interacting with empty hands toggles between sending and receiving. In receive mode the output is directional. The frequency can be changed with Dye/Pigment/Paintbrush.
book.spectrum.guidebook.reprise.page0.te:
This drink, brewed from the [#](bb00bb)Chorus Fruit[#](), inherits - and amplifies - not only the plant's special taste, but also its unique properties.\
\
When consumed, this drink will randomly teleport me over great distances. The higher the alcohol content, the further.
book.spectrum.guidebook.reprise.page1.te: *Tastes like raspberry, but there are none. Strange.*
There have always been blocks that I have been very interested in, but I have never been able to carve out of the ground carefully enough to retrieve them flawlessly. I've noticed, however, that these blocks vibrate in a similar way to the gems I've been so concerned with lately.\
If I can find the right frequency, I may finally be able to hold some of those blocks in my hands.
Uses gentle vibrations to drop some blocks as-is, preserve special properties, or turns them into something else entirely.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch, Fortune and Pest Control.
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonance.page12:
The gentle vibrations lull the silverfish hiding in the blocks.\
\
I can pack up the blocks including the Silverfish and take them with me, without them knowing what is happening to them.\
Sweet, sweet revenge.
The smaller gemstone buds are usually too fragile to be broken.\
\
However, with the right frequency, the small buds will break off the stone almost by themselves, as if I were using [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]().
Breaking [#](bb00bb)Ores[#]() with Resonance drops [Pure Resources](entry://ink/pure_resources) instead of Raw Ores.
Colored Leaves are stimulated to release many more [#](bb00bb)Saplings[#]().\
\
Applied to a hoe this will finally be my key to getting [Colored Saplings](entry://general/colored_trees) renewable.
In the depths, I have come across cages that seem to spit out an endless number of enemies. What madman put them there, what purpose they serve, and whether it was worth it with the poor loot is a mystery to me. But I can certainly find some use for them. Hopefully their creator won't miss me taking a few.
This immensely sturdy stone found in underground cities can be harvested.
Sculk Shriekers retain their ability to summon the Warden.
Brushable blocks retain their loot. I can brush them at home later.
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonance_harves: Tools enchanted with [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) are able to harvest [#](bb00bb)Budding Blocks[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonance_shards:
It turns out that the beautiful sounds of [Hummingstones](entry://dimension/hummingstone) can build on each other until they shatter in a final anthem.\
\
The shattered remains never seem to stop vibrating, even in my hands, as if they retained some form of inherent energy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.resonant_lily.pa: This is an interesting one. When [#](bb00bb)flowers[#]() absorb [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) through their roots, they turn into those elusive plants.
Is there anything more cozy than sitting by the fire on a rainy evening, sipping a cup of tea?\
Sure: killing a boss beforehand.\
\
This tea, brewed from the petals of the [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines) is good for both relaxation and protection from the deadly effects of the Wither. *Convenient*
book.spectrum.guidebook.ring_of_aerial_g:
I know myself well enough now to be the one having ones's head in the clouds.\
\
*Literally*, this time around, though!
book.spectrum.guidebook.ring_of_denser_s:
You know, I always wondered where all that Ink goes, when I infuse my small trinkets with it. Does it soak into the material like a good wine into a bunch of grapes?\
I actually wanted to build a scale. Didn't quite work out. But of course I won't let my findings go to waste.\
\
Behold: *this ring*!
Mining is my game.\
It's almost a miracle that it's only now that I've come up with the idea of upgrading not only my tools, but my mining proficiency in general. This ring will even grow with my abilities.
Can be infused with [Magenta Ink](entry://ink/ink) in a [Color Picker](entry://ink/color_picker) to increase mining speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rock_candy.page0:
A stick with [#](bb00bb)Sugar[#]() on it.\
\
...wait wait wait, I found out there's more to it!\
If I place this stick so that its underside is immersed in [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal) and I dissolve more [](item://minecraft:sugar) in the liquid, the stick will slowly turn into a sweet crunchy candy stick.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rock_candy.page1: Maybe I can add more than just Sugar to it? Liquid *Crystal* and all that...
book.spectrum.guidebook.rock_candy.page2: [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() retains its size for use as a fancy light, or simply for storage.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rock_candy.page3:
By dissolving [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) in the liquid instead of Sugar, the Rock Candy took on the typical color of the gemstone.\
\
I've always wanted to know what those taste like! Certainly seems like the healthier option compared to snorting them up my nose.
book.spectrum.guidebook.rock_crystal.pag:
Giant clusters of quartz crystals can be found dotting the [Razor Edge](entry://dimension/razor_edge).\
\
I will entirely admit that, given how nether quartz is found in loose crystals, I had forgotten just how tough quartz is when fused together like this. This stuff is **tough**.
Honestly I am a little worried the Anvil will break before the crystals do.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ruin.name: Experiment #3: Ruin
book.spectrum.guidebook.ruin.page0.text:
This is it: the perfection of my formula. One small failure definitely could not stop me.\
This may be the one thing aggressive enough to destroy even some materials I had previously deemed unbreakable.\
I won't even make it subtle. This stuff is [#](ff0000)NASTY[#]() by design, I didn't call it that for the fun of it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.ruin.page1.text:
Something tells me that if I'm not careful, I could ruin this world.\
A necessary sacrifice, really.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sawblade_holly.p:
These berries remind me of [#](bb00bb)Sweet Berries[#](). Unlike those, however, these are rather dry.\
\
Can be eaten, but have an unpleasant consistency. Better than nothing, when the going gets tough.

Harvested by shearing a Sawblade Holly Bush. Can be used as a [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents@prickly_bayleaf) and in cooking.\
\
*Clearly easier to digest cooked than raw...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.scarred.page0.te:
Prevented me from regenerating health by natural means while also preventing me from sprinting.\
\
*A vicious cycle, should something attack me*
book.spectrum.guidebook.semi_permeable_g:
Those pesky monsters that appear at night have long since ceased to be a threat to me, now merely serving as a resource supplier, if anything. But that doesn't stop them from stalking and harassing me.\
I've spent more time keeping those pesky monsters out of my base than I care to admit.

Then I remembered my [Gemstone Glass recipe](entry://decoration/gemstone_glass) that I had created earlier.\
\
With a bit of magical energy, it was no problem to make it not only transparent, but also passable for me (but not for them!).\
\
Bonus: I made it look exactly like regular glass in case I want to fool my competitors.
Looks exactly like its mundane counterpart, but only players can pass through it. All other creatures will bounce off it like a fly off a window.
Comes in all gemstone colors and a few more.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sender_node.name: Sender Node
book.spectrum.guidebook.sender_node.page:
The Sender Node will actively try to keep the connected inventory empty.\
\
The order, in which it will push items, is as follows:
1. [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node)
2. [Buffer Nodes](entry://pastel_network/buffer_node)
3. [Storage Nodes](entry://pastel_network/storage_node)
book.spectrum.guidebook.serendipity_reel:
To be honest, I do not have to fishing any more to feed myself. Still a guilty pleasure of mine. Sitting at my pond and watching the soft waves makes me feel calm.\
\
Doesn't mean I don't appreciate the occasional catch. Or two. Or three. Or...

Chance to reel in double the loot. Or more!\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Spectrum's Fishing Rods.
book.spectrum.guidebook.seven_league_boo:
Getting from A to B is tedious and my travel time only seems to increase, especially with [Geodes](entry://general/geodes) scattered across the land as they are.\
\
To solve this problem, I designed the Seven League Boots, which make me much more mobile than before.
Increases both movement speed and step height.
Further increases the movement speed bonus.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shale_clay.page0: A sedimentary rock consisting of, well, layered shale and clay. Pretty unspectacular, apart from being pretty to look at.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shale_clay.page1: I can shape Shale Clay into many decorative blocks using [#](bb00bb)Crafting[#]() or the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.shale_clay.page2:
Polishing Shale Clay brings out a nice, grayish color.\
Though it seems to [#](449900)weather over time[#](), when exposed to the elements (direct sunlight, rain), returning its natural brownish tint.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shale_clay.page4: Looks like farmland, tastes like farmland, but is poorly suited for use as such. I can plant crops on it, but they will never grow an inch.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.name: Gemstone Shards
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page0.tex:
In a [geode](entry://general/geodes) I found this interesting gemstone. Not an item like every other for sure. This one (and other ones?) are special.\
\
Each type of gem represents both an elemental color and a natural force.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page1.tex:
Topaz Shards are surprisingly heavy in my hand. This gemstone quickly proved to be one of the most robust materials I've ever handled - perhaps only surpassed by diamond. I found Topaz in geodes at the very tops of steep hills and on the summits of sky-high mountains.\
Topaz represents **[#](5bffed)MATTER.[#]()**
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page2.tex:
Magenta light is refracted in this gemstone.\
Formed over eons in the geodes, this gem radiates awe. I found this symbol of permanence in the deepest layers of the world.\
\
Amethyst represents **[#](ff4ff6)TIME[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page3.tex:
I stumbled upon this yellow gemstone near the surface level where the sun's light dissipates into warmth.\
\
Its bright yellow luster radiates pure **[#](eded00)ENERGY[#]()** and makes it slightly warm to the touch at all times.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page4.tex:
Onyx is near pitch black. It almost seems to sap the light from its surroundings.\
\
Onyx, the combination of energy, matter, and time, serves great as a focus and **[#](302951)CATALYST[#]()** for my magical tools and devices.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shards.page5.tex:
Its white glow reminds me of the soothing light of the moon on a cool summer night. The tranquillity it exudes leaves a calming yet significant impression, like a sleeping cat - balm for the soul and yet a predator, always on guard.\
\
Moonstone embodies **[#](d0d6d7)PURITY[#]()**.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shimmerstone.pag:
A vibrant amber-tinted ore that not only emits energy in the form of light, but can also manipulate it.\
\
I found Shimmerstone Ore mainly in high caves and above sea level, where the sun's light gives way to a cozy warmth.
Full blocks of Shimmerstone emit glowing bright amber particles.
book.spectrum.guidebook.shimmerstone_lig:
On my first nights in this wonderful world, I used to light my improvised hut with torches. As atmospheric as that was, it was also primitive.\
To get away from my dark, torch-lit past, I created lamps based on [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone).
There are several variants, depending on which polished block I feel like using as the base.
Blackslag can be used, too, resulting in an especially dark variant.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sleep.name: Soporific Alchemy
book.spectrum.guidebook.sleep.page0.text: Reflecting upon these night potions, it has quickly become evident that a variety of things can affect how vulnerable I am to them. As for others... the main factor is a blend of their mental constitution and biology. Arthropods are fairly resistant due to not really sleeping, whereas the restless Undead seem terribly vulnerable to it. Beings of pure will would probably be near-immune.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sleep.page1.text: As I've learned more about this branch of alchemy, I've become concerned; I feel as if the tides of slumber threaten to swallow me whole. It was a bit odd seeing multiple effects being of one essence, but I brushed it off as nothing special. Now I am not so sure. These Burgeons and their Nectar, and [Fatal Slumber](entry://brewing/effects/fatal_slumber) and its traces of light... there is an air to it, one concerningly reminiscent of [Divinity](entry://brewing/effects/divinity).
book.spectrum.guidebook.sleep_resistance: This brew is a work of elemental night alchemy and works off of velvet magic. It is thus affected by the mental constitution of the afflicted, and in my own case, sleep resistance.
book.spectrum.guidebook.slush.page0.text: Incredibly soft, moist soil. Smells like earthworm.
book.spectrum.guidebook.slush.page1.text: Ever-moist farmland, with lots of nutrients. Plants thrive on it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sniper.page0.tex:
Compared to the [#](bb00bb)Bow[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]() leads a rather inconspicuous existence.\
\
With the Sniping Enchantment however, the crossbow becomes a deadly ranged weapon.
book.spectrum.guidebook.sniper.page1.tex:
Increases damage, accuracy and projectile speed.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Crossbows.\
Mutually exclusive with Multishot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.somnolence.page0:
A [#](449900)strong, stupefying effect that scales with level[#](). This works on anything, *myself included*.\
\
On that note, this made me drowsy enough to [#](449900)sleep regardless of time or conditions,[#]() which could be very useful!
book.spectrum.guidebook.soothing_bouquet:
Night Salts were a stunning success in improving my sleep and worsening my back pain. As I've become more educated in night alchemy, however, I feel like I can execute the concept a bit better now.\
\
\
*Elegance is the name of the game, and why huff salts when I can enjoy the flowers?*

As was is as will be - nuzzle that bodacious blossom and take a deep breath.\
\
*This not an overpriced sleeping bag - it is a SUPERIOR overpriced sleeping bag!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.spawner_creature:
I found out how to assign a new type of creature to mob spawners. A somewhat terrifying ability, I must admit.\
\
Will I become the person to create life for the sake of the gift of life, or only to tear it away again immediately?
What sort of person am I? In this case, my morals must serve as a guide.
book.spectrum.guidebook.spawner_manipula:
My new [Resonance](entry://enchanting/enchantments/resonance) enchantment finally allowed me to get Spawners to drop. Look what I got here!\
While I haven't yet figured out how to make these constructs myself, I'm starting to feel comfortable altering their properties in my favor, thanks to the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).\
*This gon be gud.*
Based on my way of [remembering Memories](entry://creating_life/memories) I can change the Spawners creature association, making it spew out another type of creature altogether.
Increases the number of creatures summoned with each spawn cycle.
Lowers both min and max spawn delay.

Spawners seem to naturally stop spawning creatures when there are a lot of them around. Almost as if they want to give me a chance. *Pathetic, isn't it? As if I needed that.*\
This modification increases the number of creatures that are allowed to be near the Spawner.
Increases the distance I can be away from a spawner and it still works.
book.spectrum.guidebook.spirit_instiller:
With all the knowledge I gathered, I created the **Spirit Instiller**. I specifically designed it to combine the energies of two items, with the help of a third object to bind them.\
Like the others, the Spirit Instiller needs a focus structure to work. To rotate the structure hologram in the direction I want it to go, I am able click on the Spirit Instiller when it is placed.
An almost spiritual process, hence the name.

Dimensions: 8x9x5 blocks\
It can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades) on the two [#](bb00bb)Onyx Chiseled Blocks[#]().

- 1 Spirit Instiller
- 2 Item Bowls
- 2 Notched Polished Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 2 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Polished Pillars
- 17 Polished Slabs
- 41 Polished Blocks
- 2 Gemstone Chimes
book.spectrum.guidebook.staff_of_remembr:
*One to rule them all*\
...well, politely, of course.\
\
The Staff of Remembrance allows me to move around my animals with ease, over both short and long distances.
Tapping animals recollects them into a [Memory](entry://creating_life/memories).
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page0:
Baked [Stardust](entry://general/stargazing@stardust) tastes strangely refreshing - the magic made my tongue tingle as the heaven-sent candy dissolved in my mouth, and I felt strangely healthier afterwards. Its hard, golden flesh has a few purple flecks that shimmer like shards of stars.\
\
*I have long since stopped asking myself why I taste everything I come across.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page1: Perhaps the speckles are the source of its restorative properties? I wonder if it is possible to create a completely purple one.
book.spectrum.guidebook.star_candy.page2:
Now THAT's a tasty one!\
Just touching those star-strudded strips gave me the same tingling sensation as eating the whole thing before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.name: Stargazing
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page0: The calmness of the night often invites me to lie in the grass and watch the stars.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page1:
The small Shooting Stars are made of a material unknown to me thus far.\
\
Can I catch one right out of the sky?\
\
*I am sure they are even easier to spot when I am using a Telescope or Night Vision.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page2:
Now that I've collected all variants, it's time to unwind! Hardened with a Diamond a stars won't anymore when hit.\
\
*Fancy a Starball tournament with friends?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page3:
Shooting Stars yield valuable resources: a Star Fragment, Stardust and a variety of other rare materials.\
\
Picking up a Shooting Star by crouching and [crushing it with an Anvil](entry://general/item_crushing) will yield double the Star Fragments, albeit at the cost of the other loot.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stargazing.page4:
A powder of unknown origin blessed with the soul of the stars.\
\
*Bears coy, yet latent power.*
Knowing me, I will create the perfect tool, only to have it fall into Lava five minutes later in a moment of derangement. And then there is the dimension of the Endermen, which dramatically punishes any mistakes.\
\
This new enchantment will protect my favorite tools in case of brainfart (including being thrown against a cactus).
Protects tools from damage when on the ground, even from Lava or falling into the Void.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.
[#](449900)Decreases my attack speed[#]() with every level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storage_node.pag:
The Storage Node shows its greatest use in combination with [Sender Nodes](entry://pastel_network/sender_node) (will push to it), [Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node), and [Buffer Nodes](entry://pastel_network/buffer_node) (will pull from it).\
\
Its [#](449900)filter[#]() allows me to specify which items it will receive & provide. An empty filter makes the connected inventory act as a general store for all types of items.
book.spectrum.guidebook.storm_stones.pag:
Storms are a powerful manifestation of Mother Nature.\
Using the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) I even started one while I was crafting [some powerful resources](entry://general/onyx_shards).\
\
There is no doubt that I will find something related to them that can help me on my journey.

Dug into the ground by lightning strikes, I found these stones, vibrating in my hand with barely contained energy.\
Used in the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I can summon another thunderstorm with ease.\
\
*Because of their volatile nature, they don't react too well to explosions...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.name: Stratine
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page0.t:
This very heavy ore is scattered throughout the depths of the Nether.\
It is probably not the best idea to carry large amounts of it home at once.
book.spectrum.guidebook.stratine.page2.t:
Stratine - as I already discovered - is an exceptionally heavy material. And difficult to shape. Even the blazing heat of the Nether did it no harm.\
\
However, shaping it with my [Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) should be no problem at all.
Curiously, the combination of mushrooms and water is a perfect receptacle for all sorts of other floral notes - either rounding out the taste, or creating... very peculiar ones.\
\
Each flower has a specific effect, as if I were feeding it to a [#](449900)Brown Mooshroom[#]().
The fermentation process in colored wood makes the effect last quite a bit longer compared to [](item://minecraft:suspicious_stew).
[#](449900)Increases my attack speed[#]() with every level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.take_off_belt.pa:
Climbing mountains or misshapen caves is time consuming. If I don't see a way to scramble up an uneven ledge, I've had no choice but to carve a path into the rock - until now!\
With my new belt here I'm able to put great vertical distances behind me, sparing me time and the beautiful nature from destruction.

Sneak to charge a high jump, getting more powerful the longer I charge.\
\
*Even if the name implies it, please don't take it off.*
Increases the jump height even further.
Will give me a short slow fall effect, allowing to better navigate where to land. A high level of Feather Falling may be a viable way to get back down those cliffs again safely, actually.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.name: Tarts
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page0.text:
Although I am not the most skilled chef, even this rudimentary one tastes great!\
\
I can additionally garnish it with various toppings to grant me [#](449900)defensive abilities[#]() for a short duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page3.text:
Makes me able to see and swim in Lava as if it were Water.\
However, does NOT make me immune to fire.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page4.text: Allows me to swim at light speed and greatly increases my underwater mining rate.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page5.text: Makes me feel well rested, like after a good night's sleep. Chases away the creatures of nightmares.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tarts.page6.text: Gives me a small chance that projectiles will simply deflect off of me.
book.spectrum.guidebook.the_art_of_brewi:
The [Titration Barrel](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel) is capable of brewing alcoholic beverages. If you are of legal drinking age in your country and want to engage with recipes mentioning alcohol, you can press the button below to unlock these recipes.\
If not don't worry - you won't miss out on anything important.

Fermentation is a very natural process - things take time and care. As there is never a completely controlled environment, there are a lot of variables.\
I can follow the recipe to the letter, or play around a bit. Fermentation is an Art!

- Time: It takes time for the barrel to influence the contents. Most drinks will develop more intense and even additional effects if given more time than strictly necessary
- Temperature: The hotter it is, the more of the precious contents will simply evaporate over time. This is called the angel's share

- Humidity: The more humid the air, the more water will evaporate compared to the alcohol, making the drink stronger
- Water Share: A higher ratio of ingredients to water is a fine balance, but one to be played with. A higher thickness makes the drink ferment faster, albeit at the cost of shorter duration status effects
book.spectrum.guidebook.the_perfect_comp:
The results of my [last experiment](entry://general/failing) make me long for more: how much power can I squeeze out of these gemstones?\
I am sure there's more, and [Neolith](entry://general/neolith) must will be my entry gate! With such coherence, it may allow me to unite the powers of all the gems into one. This relic shall be the capstone to my creation, my personal Philosopher's stone, making me a living god!

Requires daytime and a clear sky.\
\
The fusion of these magical energies will stress my Fusion Shrine like nothing before - with a display to match. Best to make sure it and the blocks around it are fortified and isolated.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page0:
It almost seems like a fever dream when I remember being able to strike with weapons faster than I can think. Nowadays, each blow costs me so much energy that I have to pause for a moment.\
*Maybe I'm getting old.*\
\
With a few adjustments to my weapon, I can reduce this downtime somewhat.
book.spectrum.guidebook.tight_grip.page1:
Decreases attack cooldown.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.
book.spectrum.guidebook.titration_barrel:
The idea of fermenting [food](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel@kimchi) and [drinks](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) in [Colored Wood](entry://general/colored_trees@colored_wood) was not far to seek.\
Over time, the properties of the wood affect the contents. The results are sometimes more delicious, sometimes less delicious (though the latter could be due to my cooking skills), but always interesting.\
\
The barrel holds up to a stack of items and one bucket of liquid.
*Sometimes it feels like that when I blink the world has ceased to exist? Each time the barrel fermentation process seems to have progressed.*
Fermentation is not just for drinks! Made from 3 different vegetables, Kimchi is a hearty dish, best served as a side.
Takes a little time, but more efficient than just throwing the ingredients together.
Slightly fermented, it still retains the properties of [Milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket). Eating it will remove any status effects currently active.

A great snack. Biting off a piece is quick and even makes me feel reasonably full.\
Pleasantly sweet and fruity.
An elaborate feast of flavors that makes my mouth water just thinking about it.
Perfect for relaxing, and refreshing in the cold season.
book.spectrum.guidebook.totem_pendant.pa:
[#](bb00bb)Totems of Undying[#](), while powerful, have the significant disadvantage of requiring me to hold them in my hand at all times.\
\
Using the protective powers of [Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@blue) as a focus I can keep the totem's life-saving effect active even when worn around the neck.
One-time protection from death. Disintegrates into dust once triggered.
[#](449900)Weakened powerful attacks[#]() that hit me.\
While great against single, deadly blows, it did little against many small attacks.
I recently completed a painting, showing a fantastic creature that has appeared in my dreams: apparently made of [#](bb00bb)Soul Sand[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Wither Skeleton Skulls[#](). I waited in a Nether Fortress for hours, trying to recreate it, only to nearly lose my own head while searching for a Wither Skeleton with a spine loose enough to drop its skull. Heads up, I never were the one to bury my head in the sand.

Then I remembered the Creepers! After being struck by lightning, they explode with such force that they blow their enemies' heads right off their necks (worst case: mine).\
To replicate this, I came up with an enchantment using [Storm Stones](entry://general/storm_stones).\
And so Treasure Hunter was born, allowing me to collect [all kinds of Mob Heads](entry://creating_life/mob_heads).

Occasionally drops Mob Heads on kill.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to axes and melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.name: Trifles
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.page0.te:
Sweet delicacies, guaranteed to give me more than just a sugar rush - depending on the toppings.\
Made from [Jaramel](entry://general/jade_vines@jaramel), [#](449900)Gelatin[#]() & [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth).\
\
*Even the simple one tastes great!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.trifles.page3.te: Gives random effects. Do I fancy a gamble?
book.spectrum.guidebook.tuning_stamp.pag:
An essential part of network management is being able to fine-tune where and how things go around. This crystal stamp allows me to manually add and remove pastel nodes from networks.\
\
[#](449900)Redo[#]() a preexisting connection to unlink it.\
[#](449900)Shift-right-click[#]() to remove all connections.
*How else would I connect them? They aren't just going to automatically hook up into a mess on their own, that'd be silly!*
Oh, how cruel, how terribly cruel - that my creation is *not good enough!* Such a lacking system is below me, this cannot stand.\
\
After thinking about it a while, the solution is evident. I can use the rings of light surrounding the nodes to enhance them (which, of course, was part of my designs), all it takes is the right material...

Every node that can provide items has two ring-slots for upgrades. These rings can have upgrades applied by right-clicking on them, and removed via shift-right-click. Upgrades of the same nature will stack with each other, though often not linearly.\
\
*The upgrades always apply on the source node.*

Latency can be a problem sometimes.\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Slightly reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]()*\
â¢ Two Rings: *Modestly reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]()*

Travel time? Never heard of it.\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Significantly reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]()*\
â¢ Two Rings: *Reduces [#](449900)travel time[#]() to the utmost*

Filter? I barely know her!\
\
â¢ Each Ring: *+1 row of [#](449900)filter slots[#]()*\
â¢ Note: *[Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) gain twice as many rows.*

...not that I would mind it, though. <- *queer*\
\
â¢ Each Ring: *+2 rows of [#](449900)filter slots[#]()*\
â¢ Note: *[Gather Nodes](entry://pastel_network/gather_node) gain twice as many rows.*

Are dragons this stacked?\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Max [#](449900)transfer size[#]() of 4*\
â¢ Two Rings: *Doubles the [#](449900)previous boost[#]()*

All the things, all at once!\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Max [#](449900)transfer size[#]() of 16*\
â¢ Two Rings: *Quadruples the [#](449900)previous boost[#]() - wow.*

Steady? No. Slow? Also no!\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Appreciably boosts [#](449900)transfer rate[#]()*\
â¢ Two Rings: *Boosts [#](449900)transfer rate[#]() to the utmost*

This has no practical use but it *is* pretty.\
\
â¢ One Ring: *Makes the node [#](449900)glow brightly[#]()*\
â¢ Two Rings: No effect
book.spectrum.guidebook.turn_back_to_pol: By applying heat, all blocks can be returned to their polished state.
book.spectrum.guidebook.universe_spyhole:
The creations that [Radiating Ender](entry://general/radiating_ender) allow me to create never cease to amaze me.\
\
Placed directly on a wall or on the ground, this strange block allows me to glimpse the other side, allowing me to discover cave systems and structures... or see the sky if I am underground!
*I now see what you did there*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.name: Structure Upgrades
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page0.t:
The Pigment Pedestal and Fusion Shrine have already proven their worth. But there is always room for improvement. That's why I've created these upgrades. Each one improves the properties of my structures in a different way.\
\
Additional upgrades of the same type have a reduced effect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page1.t: Crafting times have skyrocketed recently, mostly due to the more complex components. This will help me bring the times back to an acceptable level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page2.t: The Pedestal Accelerator T2 improves on its predecessor. Making crafting even more fast.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page3.t: Tier 3 leaves nothing to be desired - at least in terms of crafting speed.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page4.t: The amount of experience I get from crafting is negligible most of the time. But with this Focus I can dramatically increase it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page5.t: This improved Knowledge Focus increases crafting XP even more.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page6.t: Allows me to cushion the consumption of my structures a little.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page7.t: This 'upgrade of the upgrade' further reduces the use use of input materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page8.t:
Although the chance is very small, I can increase the results from crafting!\
*More bang for my buck!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrades.page9.t: This upgraded version is much more powerful and has an even higher chance of increasing crafting output.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading.text:
Upgrading from level I to level II is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.upgrading_enchan:
Enchantments and Color Magic have a lot in common. So I wasn't surprised when my first attempt to combine [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) was an instant success.[#]()\
\
Placing an [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() on the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter), surrounding it with matching [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) and providing a steady stream of experience will raise the level of the book.
Interrupting said process will stop it entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.use_in_potion_wo:
Use the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop) to infuse it, by placing it where the [#](bb00bb)Bottle[#]() would normally go.\
\
To clear its effect, put it in a crafting grid.
book.spectrum.guidebook.mundane_items.pa: There are a few items that have always been difficult or even impossible to craft. My new skills make that *much* easier.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vanilla_enchantm:
The Enchanter is also able to create most enchantments I'm already familiar with.\
\
Those Enchantments can be upgraded to higher levels, too - using the same [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) used for creating it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vegetal.page0.te:
The answer seemed to be organics! Easily digestible indeed. Quite of obvious in retrospect...\
When digested by the organism, they created an interesting byproduct which I called Vegetal, representing the **raw energy of nature**.\
\
I am sure it will be very useful to me down the line.
book.spectrum.guidebook.vulnerability.pa: [#](449900)Increased incoming damage[#]() with each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weather_detector:
Citrine is very sensitive to the energies released during a storm.\
\
When exposed to rain or a thunderstorm, it emits a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]().
Rain will give a strength 8 signal, thunderstorms a full 15.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weather_manipula:
I would like to note one observation:\
Not only does the environment have an influence on the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine), I have also noticed that the [Fusion Shrine](entry://general/fusion_shrine) has an influence on its surroundings!\
\
With the right combination of materials, I can influence the weather.

*It's a brand new day\
And the sun is high\
All the birds are singing\
That you're gonna die*

*Knock Knock\
Who's there?\
Accordion\
Accordion who?\
Accordion to the forecast, it's going to rain tonight.*

*Why did the god of thunder drink water?\
\
Because he was thorsty.*
These hostile underwater temples are hell to maneuver in. Coincidentally, I stumbled upon a [#](bb00bb)Heart of The Sea[#]().\
This circlet I built with it allows me to live underwater as if it were the most natural thing in the world. I mine and swim faster, require no air and can see better.\
\
It also heals my little close by Axolotl friends. â¥

*Have I ever wanted to live underwater?\
No? Whatever, now I can! Time to build an underwater base!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.amp: Holds twice as much as a Barrel
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.lam: Emits light if it receives a Redstone signal
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.lan: I made two variants. I can switch between then by sneaking while placing it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.weeping_gala.pag:
Imposing willows adorned with pale leaves. Its sprigs weep with a sticky, sweet resin that can be used as a [Milk](item://minecraft:milk_bucket) substitute.\
\
I wonder how they grow so large when their leaves don't even have chlorophyll.
book.spectrum.guidebook.what_happened.pa:
*Tracing the history of the Deeper Down*.\
\
There is no doubt that, despite the lack of light, there must once have been a highly advanced civilisation down here. But all I have found are ruins.\
What happened? Surely I can find clues to their whereabouts. Demise? Legacy?
Is there a place I have not searched yet?
Now that Bedrock is no longer the bottom, *what* is there?
How were the ruins I found in the Overworld created?
How did the Black Langast come about?
Those bones in the Dragonrot Swamps... can they be broken?
What about those strange Crystals in the Crystal Gardens?
Can I find Geodes around here, too?
I searched far and wide for a place that I might could have missed. But no matter where I looked, there was not a single soul in sight.
Clue: Biomes
It's like turtles all the way down, isn't it? Until a moment ago I thought Bedrock was indestructible, an here I am. Unbreakable? Possibly. For now, at least.
Clue: Dimension Floor

Apparently Downstone was not completely indestructible to the previous inhabitants? It took immense, high-tech constructs, but they were able to process the stone and refine it into what I call "Preservation Stone".
Clue: Excavation Sites
The remains growing in [Black Langast](entry://dimension/black_langast) were actually Resonant Lilies, once. What happened here? Does this mean...
Clue: Black Langast

I keep coming across gigantic skeletons. Whether they were really dragons is still written in the stars, but whatever they were, they were certainly powerful. Did they wipe out the inhabitants and then somehow meet their own end?
Clue: Dragonbone
Literally humming stones with a lot of indwelling energy. When interacted with, they shake each other until they shatter wihout any further external influence. Usable as energy source?
Clue: Hummingstone
The dazzling white geodes down here are unlike any I have seen before, and hold immense magical power. But why do they only exist here? More questions...
Clue: Moonstone
book.spectrum.guidebook.whispy_circlet.p:
The bags under my eyes aren't the only evidence of my recent sleep deprivation. There are these creatures that emerged straight from the nightmares I skipped - almost as if they feel cheated.\
\
A countersolution: This manifestation of relaxation, no sleep necessary.

After just a few minutes of waring it, I feel physically and mentally refreshed and recover more quickly from any negative effects.\
\
*The pleasures of a good night's sleep.*
commands.spectrum.progression_sanity.suc: Printed the sanity checks findings to the servers console
commands.spectrum.spawn_shooting_star.su: Spawned %d shooting stars for each player
container.spectrum.bedrock_anvil.tooltip: repair cap & able to add Lore to Items

container.spectrum.rei.freezing.title: Freezing
container.spectrum.rei.heating.title: Heating
death.attack.spectrum_dike_gate: %1$s was not invited, but understood too late
death.attack.spectrum_evisceration: %1$s was skinned by a thousand cuts

book.spectrum.guidebook.mysterious_locke: There also was a little note inside... who could it have belonged to?

Now that I understand the Dreiton language, it is easy for me to decipher the inscription on the back:\
\
*Don't be silly, Asteras - the moon cannot shine, it can only reflect the light of the sun.*
